EEV415 eLOAN Transaction Module (Pandoc Multiple File Conversion)

Glossary 436

EE Documentation Library

EE Documentation Library

The EE Documentation Library lists all available manuals that serve as references on the use of the Eximbills Enterprise system. The documents are categorized into three groups: Core System Manuals, EE Utility References, and Installation Guides.

Core System Manuals

The EE Core System manuals provide details on the setup and configuration of various EE parameters, as well as the implementation of supplementary functionalities supported by the system.

Archiving and Recovery

This manual is a reference to the Archive and Recovery functionality of the EE system. Discussions include the required parameter settings for configuring the relevant functions, as well as examples of how this functionality is used in transaction processes. The archiving functions discussed in this manual are Archive Data, Inquire Archived Data, Restore Archived Data, Delete Archived Data, and End of Month functions.

BIRT Report Engine

This manual discusses the requirements and processes involved in applying the built-in BIRT report engine of EE to build transaction functions that generate BIRT reports and documents. Other functionalities, such as configuring a report batch function and defining rules to attach documents to an outgoing e-mail, are covered as well.

Building a Module

This manual is designed to help new users of EE plan, organize, control, and successfully carry out the implementation of the system. It provides a general description of the different features of EE that enable every bank to build and design business modules according to its processing requirements. This manual discusses how a custom business module in EE can be built and adapted. It includes step-by-step procedures on how to build a module as well as an overview of runtime transaction processing.

Charges and Commissions Reference

This document provides extensive discussions on the setup and usage of the Charges and Commissions component of EE. Instructions include setting up parameters, defining the relevant standing data, and using charge-specific calculation methods.

Data Objects

This manual describes in detail the steps and procedures required in building and utilizing a data object, which is a logical object that has its own attributes and calculation rules. Instructions on customizing the DO screen interface, navigating the data object screen, and using data objects in transaction processes are also provided.

eLOAN Transaction Module

This document provides extensive discussions on EE’s eLOAN sub-system. Topics include eLOAN functions from the eLOAN Transaction Module and the EE Standing Data Module.

FAQs

This document addresses commonly asked questions about the EE system. This includes answers to issues related to browser-side processing, EE Utility, EE database, Security Manager, and other issues that may arise while operating and configuring settings within the EE environment. Some system features and capabilities are discussed as well.

GAPI Integration

This manual is a comprehensive reference guide on setting up the required parameters for sending and receiving GAPI messages. It includes instructions on the configuration of related functionalities and auxiliary operations, as well as discussions on actual transaction processing.

Limit Management Module

This document provides extensive discussions on the Limits sub-system of EE. The manual is divided into two parts:

  • The first part discusses all the browser functions of the Limit Management module.

  • The second part discusses the required parameter settings to integrate Limits settings and data with a business module.

Limit Transaction Module

This document provides extensive discussions on running and using the functions of the Limit Transaction module.

Log Settings

This manual provides instructions on defining EE log settings and configuring parameters to set up log functions. Generating logs on different modes and checking the different log directories are discussed as well.

Multi-Entity Reference

This manual is a guide to the multi-entity structure of the EE system. This includes a discussion on the composition of the system in relation to this structure. EE also supports the use of a single and default domain; a supplementary section is provided for this.

Multi-Language Reference

This manual provides instructions on defining language records and configuring the multi-language settings in the EE Utility and EE browser. With this multi-language functionality, users are able to access the EE system in their preferred language.

Payment Component Reference

This document provides extensive discussions on the setup and usage of the different Payment component types: Payment Terms, Payment Schedule, Payment Instruction Dealer, and Payment Dealer. Topics include parameter settings and Payment-specific calculation methods.

Security Manager

This manual is a comprehensive guide to security management in the EE system. As such, it includes instructions on the setup of user profiles, user functions, business units, business unit functions, user and business unit assignments, and other security-related operations.

Service Level Agreement Reference

This document is a reference to the Service Level Agreement (SLA) functionality of EE the system, which pertains to a group of settings that control the flow of transaction steps and processes. It is divided into two major sections: Basic Data, for the functions used in the creation and maintenance of SLA standing data; and System Operations, for the functions used in SLA enquiry, business task initialization, and end time adjustments. A sample SLA process is also provided.

Standing Data Module

This document discusses the functions for the standing data of the EE system. Among these are rate descriptions, exchange rates, interest rates, account numbers, currencies, weekend data, holiday data, clauses, reference number rules, authorization standing data, and time zone data. Descriptions, input details, and processing steps are included in the function discussions.

Supplementary Functions

This manual is a reference in configuring the parameter settings to define special or supplementary EE functionalities such as the Compliance Check and invoice uploading features.

SWIFT Configuration

This document provides extensive discussions on the primary components required in defining SWIFT messages: the SWIFT template and the SWIFT message rule. The complete parameter settings and external configurations required for enabling EE to exchange messages with the SWIFT network are detailed in comprehensive procedures. This manual is supplemented with sections on SWIFT-related system parameters and miscellaneous functions.

System Administration Functions

This manual is a reference for Super Administrator users of the EE Utility in the configuration and maintenance of the EE environment. Sections of this reference include instructions on the use of specific User Manage and Parameter Manage functions.

System Maintenance Module

This document discusses the functions provided in the System Maintenance module of the EE system. This includes sections on the maintenance processes for daily operations, authorization rule settings, EDI messages, SWIFT messages, XML messages, log files, and documents.

System Reference

This manual is a reference for the following elements provided in the EE Utility for parameterization: security parameters, system parameters, components, server side system methods, calculation methods, and XML Generator items.

Version Control

This manual discusses the settings in maintaining the different versions of parameters.

{#section .CS-head2}

{#section-1 .CS-head2}

EE Utility References

The EE Utility set of reference manuals is a guide on the use of the Eximbills Enterprise Utility Workbench, or simply EE Utility. These references discuss every function or feature of the EE Utility and provide instructions on how to operate or use the function in relation to operating and maintaining the EE system and processing a business transaction.

A manual is provided for each major function group of the EE Utility: User Manage, Parameter Manage, System Function, Transaction Function, and Maintenance.

{width="0.3298611111111111in” height="0.3298611111111111in”}NOTE: The TSU Parameter Manage function group is comprised of functions used for configuring, managing and maintaining parameters for the TSU (or Open Account) module. For details on the TSU module, refer to the EE Baseline TSU documentation.

EE Utility Reference: User Manager Functions

This manual is a comprehensive guide for the Administrator and Operator user on the use and configuration of the functions belonging to the User Manage function group of the EE Utility. This includes functions for user profiles and audit logs.

EE Utility Reference: Parameter Manager Functions

This manual is a reference on the use and configuration of the functions that belong to the Parameter Manage function group of the EE Utility and that are accessible to Administrator and Operator users. These are system-wide functions used for creating and maintaining system parameters, components, and calculation rules, among others.

EE Utility Reference: System Functions

This manual includes details on the configuration of the functions belonging to the System Function group of the EE Utility. The functions in this group are used to maintain settings that facilitate system-wide tasks and operations; among these are function groups, output devices, protocol managers, and STP settings.

EE Utility Reference: Transaction Functions

This manual provides discussions on the configuration of the functions belonging to the Transaction Function group of the EE Utility. These functions are used for defining and setting up the actual business parameters of transaction functions.

EE Utility Reference: Maintenance Functions

This manual is a comprehensive guide on the use and configuration of the functions belonging to the Maintenance function group of the EE Utility. These functions are used for maintaining the tables, fields, and files that are used in the EE Utility.

Installation Guide

An EE installation guide is a reference on the installation and setup processes of the EE system on a specific application server and database.

Installation Guide WAS 9.0 - Oracle 12c

This is a reference for installing the EE system on WebSphere Application Server Version 9.0.5.5, with an Oracle 12c database. This includes detailed instructions on configuring the components that are required to successfully run EE.

Introduction

  • system overview

  • manual overview

System Overview

eLOAN is the Eximbill Enterprise (EE) sub-system that controls all interest-processing transactions from any of these types of systems:

  • Legacy systems

  • Trade finance systems

  • Factoring systems

  • Forfeiting systems

This sub-system is a solution for calculating the interest on interest-bearing transactions and posting relevant interest entries to specified interest receivable or interest income accounts. It supports two types of interest processing: accrual and amortization.

The eLOAN Transaction Module is used for processing eLOAN-related transactions without having to go through the normal cycle of the business module. For accrual, amortization, batch processes, and Back Valuation processes, this module provides the following function groups:

  • eLOAN Accrual Functions

  • eLOAN Amortization Functions

  • eLOAN Batch Functions

  • eLOAN Inquire Functions

Function Access

A user only has access to function groups—and their corresponding transactions—to which he has been given the appropriate rights. The assignment of function access rights, as well as other security settings, is defined through the EE Security Manager. To run a function: access the module, open the function group, and click on the function name. Example: eLOAN Transaction > eLOAN Accrual Functions > Accrual Takedown.

Manual Overview

[Purpose]{.underline}

This document provides extensive discussions on EE’s eLOAN sub-system. Topics include eLOAN functions from the eLOAN Transaction Module and the EE Standing Data Module.

[Audience]{.underline}

This document is a reference specifically for, but not limited to, the following users:

  • Browser users tasked to maintain eLOAN settings and data

[Prerequisites]{.underline}

This document is written with the assumption that the reader has sufficient knowledge of accrual, amortization, and related business concepts.

Suggested titles before reading this manual are as follows:

  • EE Building a Module

  • EE Installation Guide

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Some features discussed in this manual have been tested and documented based on an older system version. Unless otherwise specified, the overall functionality is the same when recreated in the current version.

eLOAN

  • Introduction to eloan

  • eloan process

  • eloan gapi

  • eloan logs

{#section-2 .CS-head1}

Introduction to eLOAN

eLOAN is an independent system which receives incoming transactions, processes interest calculation, and then handles the output results. eLOAN transactions may be by single or batch mode, in which the interest on interest-bearing transactions are calculated, and interest entries to specified interest receivable or interest income accounts, are posted. It also identifies all closed transactions which have been paid off or have reached maturity.

The eLOAN system supports two types of interest processing: accrual and amortization.

  • Accrued interest is the interest that is calculated from the last

    interest payment. A borrower receives the full amount of the loan, from which the interest is calculated periodically depending on the specified frequency (e.g.,monthly, annually). The borrower then pays this interest on this frequency until the end date of the loan. The accrued interest is calculated a day after the last day on which the borrower paid his interest (e.g., last day of the month), up to the day that his interest is again due (e.g.,last day of the succeeding month). In the eLOAN system, several methods or basis of accrual are made available to calculate the accrued interest. (e.g., daily, monthly, ACT/ACT_ISDA). Once the accrued interest is calculated, the eLOAN system continues to accrue the interest for a certain time period based on the coupon payment frequency. Penalties may be charged for late interest payment.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The borrower may prefer to pay the principal partially, or may opt to pay the principal at the end of the maturity date of the loan. For partial payment, the accrued interest is then calculated based on the new principal amount of the loan, to which the payment made is subtracted.

[EXAMPLE: ]{.underline}

Frequency: monthly

Principal: 10,000

Interest rate: 2%

Last interest paid: Dec 31

P10,000 * 2% * (number of days from jan 1-31 = 30 days) = P16.67 (accrued interest)

The eLOAN system also supports transactions related to bonds, and provides the process of amortization of Bond Premium/Discount, which is achieved in the eLOAN Accrual process. A bond is a debt security in which the issuer owes the holder a debt, and is obliged to pay the interest (coupon), and/or repay the principal at the bond’s maturity. Bonds are often payable at fixed intervals. (e.g., annually, semi-annually.) If a bond’s face value is higher than the market value, the difference is called premium. Bond discount, however, is the difference between the amount received for the bond (excluding accrued interest) and the bond’s face amount.

  • Amortization, on the other hand, involves the discounting of a loan

    amount at a particular rate as determined by an amortization schedule. The interest charged at the time of the creation of the loan and is subtracted to the principal amount that the borrower receives. The outstanding amount is collected in full at the maturity of the loan.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The borrower may prefer to pay the principal partially, or may opt to pay the principal at the end of the maturity date of the loan.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Principal: 10,000

Interest rate: 2%

Date of loan: Jan 1 – June 30

Frequency: monthly

P10,000 * 2% * 181 days (jan1-june30) /360 = P100.55

The amount to be released to the borrower is 10,000-100.55 = P9,899.45

The amortization of the interest is then calculated by the bank based on the account type setting which is specified in each amortization transaction.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Interest is considered a bank’s income. For accrued interest, the bank’s income is realized once the borrower pays the interest that is calculated periodically. For amortized interest, however, the bank’s income is realized from the start of the loan to which the interest has already been paid and subtracted to the principal amount released to the borrower.

Through the functions in the eLOAN Transaction module, these operations can be manually tested or simulated: processing of loans such as payment of principal and/or interest; extending/shortening of the loan due date; refunding of paid interest; changing interest rates; and applying penalty rates. Accrued or amortized interests may be postponed, restarted, rolled back, or cancelled.

eLOAN accounting entries, floating rate IDs, and system parameters used to activate specific features of the eLOAN system are configured in the eLOAN maintenance functions in the Standing Data Module.

The EE system communicates with the eLOAN system through the interfaces via JMS, EJB and Web Services mechanisms. Once the relevant eLOAN settings are configured, the GAPI template must be defined and the relevant GAPI mappings set, which are to be used for the exchange of data between EE and the eLOAN system. When the transaction – which is run in the function to which the GAPI rule is attached – is processed, interest calculation and the relevant posting is performed by eLOAN, based on the settings configured for the specific eLOAN transaction.

{#section-3 .CS-head1}

eLOAN Process

To calculate accrued and amortized interest, the following configurations must be performed.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The eLOAN Accrual and eLOAN Amortization functions in the eLOAN Transaction Module are normally used for testing purposes. In a typical project development process, the relevant functions – which include the required business fields – are created in the EE system, and then the relevant eLOAN GAPI templates are appended to these functions to integrate with the eLOAN sub-system for the accrued/amortized interest calculation. The eLOAN Inquire and eLOAN Batch functions, however, can be used by end users to view the eLOAN interest calculations and run batch processes manually.

Preliminary Settings

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Accrual

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. height="1.66736111111 | | Use this function to | | 1111in”} | | modify the details of | | | | an Accrual | | | | transaction | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | [Accrual | | ![](./media/image16.p | | ReTakedown]{.underlin | | ng){width="3.5in” | | e} | | height="1.66736111111 | | | | 1111in”} | | If the original loan | | | | amount must be | | | | increased, specify | | | | the relevant | | | | configurations in | | | | this function. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | *[Accrual Extend and | | ![](./media/image17.p | | Shorten]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | * | | height="1.66736111111 | | | | 1111in”} | | Use this function if | | | | the due date of the | | | | loan must be extended | | | | or shortened. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **[Accrual Refund | | ![](./media/image18.p | | Interest]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | ** | | height="1.66736111111 | | | | 1111in”} | | If the customer has | | | | already paid the | | | | interest, and this | | | | interest must be | | | | refunded, configure | | | | the required settings | | | | in this function. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | [Accrual Rate | | ![](./media/image19.p | | Change]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.66736111111 | | To modify the | | 1111in”} | | interest rate to be | | | | applied to the loan | | | | transaction, specify | | | | the new rate in this | | | | function. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | [Accrual Change | | ![](./media/image20.p | | Account | | ng){width="3.5in” | | Type]{.underline} | | height="1.66736111111 | | | | 1111in”} | | To modify the account | | | | type in an accrual | | | | transaction, specify | | | | the relevant | | | | configurations in | | | | this function. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | [Accrual Change | | ![](./media/image21.p | | Base | | ng){width="3.5in” | | Days]{.underline} | | height="1.66736111111 | | | | 1111in”} | | Use this function to | | | | change the base days | | | | to be used when | | | | calculating the | | | | interest of | | | | transactions. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | [Accrual Change | | ![](./media/image22.j | | Penalty | | peg) | | Rate]{.underline} | | | | | | | | Late interest | | | | payments require | | | | penalty. To change | | | | the penalty rate to | | | | be applied for late | | | | interest payment, | | | | define the new rate | | | | in this function. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **[Accrual Inquire | | ![](./media/image23.p | | Interest]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | ** | | height="1.61180555555 | | | | 55555in”} | | Use this function to | | | | view the interest | | | | accrued over a | | | | specified period. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | [Accrual | | ![](./media/image24.p | | Stop]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.61180555555 | | Use this function to | | 55555in”} | | stop the accrual of | | | | interest and the | | | | posting of a | | | | transaction, | | | | temporarily. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | *[Accrual | | ![](./media/image25.p | | Restart]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | * | | height="1.61180555555 | | | | 55555in”} | | To restore a stopped | | | | transaction, | | | | configure the | | | | relevant details in | | | | this function. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **[Accrual | | ![](./media/image26.p | | Rollback]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | ** | | height="1.61180555555 | | | | 55555in”} | | Use this function to | | | | rollback all the | | | | eLOAN events | | | | performed up to a | | | | defined rollback | | | | date. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | [Accrual | | ![](./media/image27.p | | Cancel]{.underline} | | ng){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.61180555555 | | Use this function to | | 55555in”} | | cancel an accrual | | | | loan transaction | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. Once the | | ![](./media/image28.p | | relevant function | | ng){width="3.5in” | | is configured, the | | height="1.85694444444 | | GAPI template must | | 44445in”} | | be set. Each | | | | transaction has a | | | | corresponding | | | | transaction code, | | | | which must be used | | | | as the interface | | | | name when | | | | configuring the | | | | GAPI template. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE]{.underline}: | | | | ** | | | | | | | | Refer to [Appendix C: | | | | eLOAN | | | | GAPI](#appb_eloanGAPI | | | | ) | | | | for more details on | | | | the transaction codes | | | | that correspond to | | | | each eLOAN | | | | transaction, as well | | | | as the tags to be | | | | assigned for each | | | | template. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Depending on the | | ![](./media/image29.p | | eLOAN transaction, | | ng){width="3.5in” | | specify the type of | | height="1.85694444444 | | transaction for the | | 44445in”} | | GAPI template. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. Specify the | | ![](./media/image30.p | | relevant Send tags | | ng){width="3.5in” | | for the GAPI | | height="1.85694444444 | | template, which are | | 44445in”} | | to be used to send | | | | the details to the | | | | eLOAN sub-system. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. Specify the | | ![](./media/image31.p | | Receive tags which | | ng){width="3.5in” | | are to be used to | | height="1.85694444444 | | receive the details | | 44445in”} | | from the eLOAN | | | | sub-system. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. Configure the | | ![](./media/image32.p | | GAPI mapping | | ng){width="3.5in” | | settings. | | height="1.85694444444 | | | | 44445in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 7. Assign the GAPI | | ![](./media/image33.p | | mapping rule to the | | ng){width="3.5in” | | relevant function | | height="1.85694444444 | | to which the | | 44445in”} | | interest accrual | | | | calculation is to | | | | be applied. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 8. When the | | ![](./media/image34.p | | transaction is run | | ng){width="3.5in” | | in the relevant | | height="1.61180555555 | | function to which | | 55555in”} | | the GAPI rule is | | | | attached, settings | | | | from eLOAN is | | | | applied to the | | | | transaction. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: eLOAN Batch and Inquire functions may also be utilized in the corresponding functions in the eLOAN Transaction Module.

{#section-4 .CS-head1}

eLOAN GAPI

Once the relevant eLOAN transaction is configured, the GAPI template must be defined and the relevant GAPI mappings set, which are to be used for the exchange of data between EE and the eLOAN system. The GAPI templates to be configured are based on the eLOAN transaction. Each eLOAN transaction has a corresponding transaction code which is used as the interface name when setting up the GAPI template in the EE Utility.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

Accrual Takedown (Master) = 8030

Specific tags may be used for the template based on the eLOAN transaction. Some tags are mandatory, and some tags are optional depending on the requirements. The EE transaction may then send or receive the GAPI message – which is in XML format – via EJB.

+———————————————————————–+ | <gapi> | | | | <header> | | | | <ec-flag>F</ec-flag> | | | | <jndi-flag>N</jndi-flag> | | | | <gapi-type>EJB</gapi-type> | | | | <gapi-type-value>GAPI2IATrxBusiness</gapi-type-value> | | | | <reformat-class/> | | | | <time-out-ack-delay>0</time-out-ack-delay> | | | | <time-out-ack> | | | | <send-queue-id/> | | | | <recv-queue-id/> | | | | <recv-time-out>0</recv-time-out> | | | | </time-out-ack> | | | | <other-system-id>eLOAN</other-system-id> | | | | <other-system-interface>8030</other-system-interface> | | | | <recv-time-out>0</recv-time-out> | | | | <is-trx>N</is-trx> | | | | <send-queue-id/> | | | | <recv-queue-id/> | | | | <msg-format/> | | | | <module/> | | | | <interface-mapping-name/> | | | | <other-system-desc>eLOAN</other-system-desc> | | | | <trx-type>R</trx-type> | | | | <gapi-mode conditional="false" gapiMode="" mode="SYNC"/> | | | | </header> | | | | <selector-setting> | | | | <send/> | | | | <recv/> | | | | </selector-setting> | | | | <send-msg-tag> | | | | <C_UNIT_CODE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="1"/> | | | | <IA_C_MODU_NAME ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="2"/> | | | | <IA_C_REF_NO ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="3"/> | | | | <IA_C_BORROWER_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="4"/> | | | | <IA_C_ACCOUNT_TYPE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="5"/> | | | | <IA_D_TRX_VALDATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="6"/> | | | | <IA_C_CCY_CODE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="7"/> | | | | <IA_Y_TRX_AMT ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="8"/> | | | | <IA_I_BASE_DAYS ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="9"/> | | | | <IA_D_DUE_DATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="10"/> | | | | <IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="11"/> | | | | <IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="12"/> | | | | <IA_C_FLT_RAT_TBLID ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="13"/> | | | | <IA_I_FLT_RATE_NO ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="14"/> | | | | <IA_C_SPR_RAT_TBLID ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="15"/> | | | | <IA_I_SPR_RATE_NO ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="16"/> | | | | <IA_C_AUTODBT_FLG ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="17"/> | | | | <IA_N_BUSINESS_TAX ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="18"/> | | | | <IA_N_STAMP_TAX ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="19"/> | | | | <IA_C_TRANS_CODE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="20"/> | | | | <IA_C_CUST_CODE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="21"/> | | | | <IA_N_EXCH_RATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="22"/> | | | | <IA_I_CCY_DEC ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="23"/> | | | | <IA_C_CREATE_FROM ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="24"/> | | | | <IA_C_FUNCTION_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="25"/> | | | | <IA_D_CREATE_DATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="26"/> | | | | <IA_C_CREATE_BY ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" | | op-tag="N" order="27"/> | | | | <IA_C_AMZ_FLG ec-tag="N" fv-type="" op-tag="N" | | order="28"/> | | | | <IA_C_DLY_FLG ec-tag="N" fv-type="" op-tag="N" | | order="29"/> | | | | <IA_C_SCHE_TYPE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" op-tag="N" | | order="30"/> | | | | <IA_D_LAST_CPNDATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" op-tag="N" | | order="31"/> | | | | <IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT ec-tag="N" fv-type="" op-tag="N" | | order="32"/> | | | | <IA_C_CPN_TYPE ec-tag="N" fv-type="" op-tag="N" | | order="33"/> | | | | <IA_C_PURP_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="34"/> | | | | <IA_C_FORM_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="" multi="N" op-tag="N" | | order="35"/> | | | | </send-msg-tag> | | | | <recv-msg-tag> | | | | <IA_C_EVENT_NO fv-type="" op-tag="N" order="1"/> | | | | </recv-msg-tag> | | | | <translateRule/> | | | | </gapi> | +———————————————————————–+

Figure 2. 1 Example: eLOAN Accrual Takedown (Master) GAPI Template

+———————————————————————–+ | <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> | | | | <gapi> | | | | <header> | | | | <ec-flag>F</ec-flag> | | | | <jndi-flag>N</jndi-flag> | | | | <gapi-type>EJB</gapi-type> | | | | <gapi-type-value>GAPI2IATrxBusiness</gapi-type-value> | | | | <reformat-class/> | | | | <time-out-ack-delay>0</time-out-ack-delay> | | | | <time-out-ack> | | | | <send-queue-id/> | | | | <recv-queue-id/> | | | | <recv-time-out>0</recv-time-out> | | | | </time-out-ack> | | | | <other-system-id>eLOAN</other-system-id> | | | | <other-system-interface>8030</other-system-interface> | | | | <recv-time-out>0</recv-time-out> | | | | <is-trx>N</is-trx> | | | | <send-queue-id/> | | | | <recv-queue-id/> | | | | <msg-format/> | | | | <module>IAAC</module> | | | | <interface-mapping-name>eLOAN_Acc_Takedown</interface-mapping-na | | me> | | | | <other-system-desc/> | | | | <trx-type>R</trx-type> | | | | <gapi-mode conditional="false" gapiMode="" mode="SYNC"/> | | | | <gapi-resend>N</gapi-resend> | | | | <atth-queue-id/> | | | | </header> | | | | <selector-setting> | | | | <send/> | | | | <recv/> | | | | </selector-setting> | | | | <send-msg-map> | | | | <C_UNIT_CODE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="1">C_UNIT_CODE</C_UNIT_CODE> | | | | <IA_C_MODU_NAME ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="2">IA_C_MODU_NAME</IA_C_MODU_NAME> | | | | <IA_C_REF_NO ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="3">IA_C_REF_NO</IA_C_REF_NO> | | | | <IA_C_BORROWER_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="4">IA_C_BORROWER_ID</IA_C_BORROWER_ID> | | | | <IA_C_ACCOUNT_TYPE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="5">IA_C_ACCOUNT_TYPE</IA_C_ACCOUNT_TYPE> | | | | <IA_D_TRX_VALDATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="6">IA_D_TRX_VALDATE</IA_D_TRX_VALDATE> | | | | <IA_C_CCY_CODE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="7">IA_C_CCY_CODE</IA_C_CCY_CODE> | | | | <IA_Y_TRX_AMT ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="8">IA_Y_TRX_AMT</IA_Y_TRX_AMT> | | | | <IA_I_BASE_DAYS ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="9">IA_I_BASE_DAYS</IA_I_BASE_DAYS> | | | | <IA_D_DUE_DATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="10">IA_D_DUE_DATE</IA_D_DUE_DATE> | | | | <IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="11">IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE</IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE> | | | | <IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="12">IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE</IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE> | | | | <IA_C_FLT_RAT_TBLID ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="13">IA_C_FLT_RAT_TBLID</IA_C_FLT_RAT_TBLID> | | | | <IA_I_FLT_RATE_NO ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="14">IA_I_FLT_RATE_NO</IA_I_FLT_RATE_NO> | | | | <IA_C_SPR_RAT_TBLID ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="15">IA_C_SPR_RAT_TBLID</IA_C_SPR_RAT_TBLID> | | | | <IA_I_SPR_RATE_NO ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="16">IA_I_SPR_RATE_NO</IA_I_SPR_RATE_NO> | | | | <IA_C_AUTODBT_FLG ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="17">IA_C_AUTODBT_FLG</IA_C_AUTODBT_FLG> | | | | <IA_N_BUSINESS_TAX ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="22">IA_N_EXCH_RATE</IA_N_EXCH_RATE> | | | | <IA_I_CCY_DEC ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="23">IA_I_CCY_DEC</IA_I_CCY_DEC> | | | | <IA_C_CREATE_FROM ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="24">IA_C_CREATE_FROM</IA_C_CREATE_FROM> | | | | <IA_C_FUNCTION_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="25">IA_C_FUNCTION_ID</IA_C_FUNCTION_ID> | | | | <IA_D_CREATE_DATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="26">IA_D_CREATE_DATE</IA_D_CREATE_DATE> | | | | <IA_C_CREATE_BY ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="27">IA_C_CREATE_BY</IA_C_CREATE_BY> | | | | <IA_C_AMZ_FLG ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="28">IA_C_AMZ_FLG</IA_C_AMZ_FLG> | | | | <IA_C_DLY_FLG ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="29">IA_C_DLY_FLG</IA_C_DLY_FLG> | | | | <IA_C_SCHE_TYPE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="30">IA_C_SCHE_TYPE</IA_C_SCHE_TYPE> | | | | <IA_D_LAST_CPNDATE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="31">IA_D_LAST_CPNDATE</IA_D_LAST_CPNDATE> | | | | <IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="32">IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT</IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT> | | | | <IA_C_CPN_TYPE ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="33">IA_C_CPN_TYPE</IA_C_CPN_TYPE> | | | | <IA_C_PURP_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="34">IA_C_PURP_ID</IA_C_PURP_ID> | | | | <IA_C_FORM_ID ec-tag="N" fv-type="F" op-tag="N" | | order="35">IA_C_FORM_ID</IA_C_FORM_ID> | | | | </send-msg-map> | | | | <recv-msg-map> | | | | <IA_C_EVENT_NO fv-type="F" order="1" sheet="" | | sheet-separator="">IA_C_EVENT_NO</IA_C_EVENT_NO> | | | | </recv-msg-map> | | | | <translateRule/> | | | | <send-item/> | | | | </gapi> | +———————————————————————–+

Figure 2. 2 Example: eLOAN Accrual Takedown (Master) GAPI Mapping

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. Refer to Appendix C: eLOAN GAPI for more details on the transaction codes that correspond to an eLOAN transaction, as well as the relevant Send and Receive tags that may be added for each transaction.

ii. Refer to the EE GAPI Integration manual for more details on GAPI settings.

{#section-5 .CS-head1}

eLOAN Logs

Logs generated for eLOAN transactions are recorded following the standard log features used in standard EE transactions.

If the transaction is performed by the user, the related log information are recorded into the EE user level log file. Otherwise, if the transaction is processed by batch, the related log information are recorded into the system level log file.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the EE Log Settings manual for more details on the log types of the EE system.

Figure 2. 3 Example: System EE Log

Figure 2. 4 Example: System SQL Log

Figure 2. 5 Example: Application SystemErr Log

Figure 2. 6 Example: Application SystemOut Log

{#section-6 .CS-ChapterTitle}

eLOAN Accrual Functions

  • Introduction to the eLOAN Accrual Functions

  • Accrual Takedown

  • Accrual Payment

  • Accrual ReTakedown

  • Accrual Extend and SHorten

  • Accrual Refund Interest

  • Accrual Rate Change

  • Accrual Amend

  • Accrual Change Account Type

  • Accrual Change Base Days

  • Accrual Change Penalty Rate

  • Accrual Inquire Interest

  • Accrual Stop

  • Accrual Restart

  • Accrual Rollback

  • Accrual Cancel

  • ELOAN REVERSE POSTING

{#section-7 .CS-head1}

Introduction to the eLOAN Accrual Functions

Accrual pertains to the periodic calculation of interest for an amount over a period of time. Accrued interest is not charged at the time of creation of the loan. Hence, the money lent to the borrower is the full amount of the principal, with interest charged to the loan on a periodic basis.

The eLOAN Accrual Functions group consists of the following functions:

  • Accrual Takedown

  • Accrual Payment

  • Accrual ReTakedown

  • Accrual Extend and Shorten

  • Accrual Refund Interest

  • Accrual Rate Change

  • Accrual Amend

  • Accrual Change Account Type

  • Accrual Change Base Days

  • Accrual Change Penalty Rate

  • Accrual Inquire Interest

  • Accrual Stop

  • Accrual Restart

  • Accrual Rollback

  • Accrual Cancel

  • eLOAN Reverse Posting

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The process of amortization of Bond Premium/Discount is supported, which is achieved in the eLOAN Accrual process. A bond is a debt security in which the issuer owes the holder a debt, and is obliged to pay the interest (coupon), and/or repay the principal at the bond’s maturity. Bonds are often payable at fixed intervals. (e.g., annually, semi-annually.) If a bond’s face value is higher than the market value, the difference (excluding accrued interest) is called premium. Bond discount, however, is the difference between the amount received for the bond (excluding accrued interest) and the bond’s face amount. The following accounting entries are processed:

• Accounting Entry for Amortization of Bond Premium

Dr. Interest Receivable

Cr. Exchange Rate

Dr. Exchange Rate

Cr. Interest Income

Dr. Interest Income

Cr. Exchange

Dr. Exchange

Cr. Premium A/C

• Accounting Entry for Amortization of Bond Discount

Dr. Interest Receivable

Cr. Exchange Rate

Dr. Exchange Rate

Cr. Interest Income

Dr. Discount A/C No.

Cr. Exchange

Dr. Exchange

Cr. Interest Income

ii. The eLOAN Accrual and eLOAN Amortization functions in the eLOAN Transaction Module are normally used for testing purposes. In a typical project development process, the relevant functions – which include the required business fields – are created in the EE system, and then the relevant eLOAN GAPI templates are appended to these functions to integrate with the eLOAN sub-system for the accrued/amortized interest calculation. The eLOAN Inquire and eLOAN Batch functions, however, can be used by end users to view the eLOAN interest calculations and run batch processes manually.

{#section-8 .CS-head1}

Accrual Takedown

The Accrual Takedown function is used for initiating the creation of an Accrual transaction.

Figure 3. 1 Accrual Takedown Function

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | This is the unique | | | | system-generated | | | | transaction reference | | | | number for the | | | | record. This | | | | reference number may | | | | come from another | | | | module. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Borrower ID | | Specify the Id of the | | | | Borrower. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | This value must match | | | | the corresponding | | | | customer record in | | | | EE. This is typically | | | | mapped from the EE | | | | transaction. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account Type | | Select an account | | | | type for the Borrower | | | | from the dropdown | | | | list. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The available account | | | | types are defined in | | | | the eLOAN Account | | | | Type functions of the | | | | Standing Data module. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction Value | | Specify the date of | | Date | | the takedown. The | | | | date may be defined | | | | using the calendar | | | | function that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The Transaction Value | | | | Date must be later | | | | than or the same date | | | | as the Last Coupon | | | | Payment Date. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Currency Code | | Select the relevant | | | | currency from the | | | | dropdown list. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction | | Specify the loan | | Amount | | amount. The field | | | | must have a positive | | | | value. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Fixed Base Rate | | Specify the fixed | | | | base rate. The rate | | | | is not changed unless | | | | an event for Change | | | | Rate is executed. It | | | | is applied when the | | | | transaction uses | | | | fixed rate. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The eLOAN system | | | | supports 0 rate for | | | | premium interest. If | | | | the value updated in | | | | the Fixed Base Rate | | | | and Fixed Spread Rate | | | | fields is 0, the | | | | eLOAN system still | | | | automatically | | | | generates the | | | | schedule and | | | | premium/discount | | | | details. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Fixed Spread Rate | | Specify the fixed | | | | spread rate. This | | | | rate is not changed | | | | unless an event for | | | | Change Rate is | | | | executed. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | i. A spread rate is | | | | added to or | | | | subtracted from a | | | | rate to cover | | | | customer risk | | | | levels. Hence, | | | | this field can | | | | accept either a | | | | positive or | | | | negative value. | | | | The spread rate | | | | may be defined | | | | according to | | | | customer type or | | | | transaction type. | | | | | | | | ii. The eLOAN system | | | | supports 0 rate | | | | for premium | | | | interest. If the | | | | value updated in | | | | the Fixed Base | | | | Rate and Fixed | | | | Spread Rate | | | | fields is 0, the | | | | eLOAN system | | | | still | | | | automatically | | | | generates the | | | | schedule and | | | | premium/discount | | | | details. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Penalty Rate | | Specify the penalty | | | | interest that is to | | | | be used as a basis | | | | for calculating the | | | | Accrual interest for | | | | overdue amounts. This | | | | penalty rate is used | | | | (and not the default | | | | penalty rate defined | | | | in the eLOAN Account | | | | Type setting) if the | | | | penalty rate is | | | | passed to eLOAN in an | | | | Accrual takedown. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Grace Days | | Specify the number of | | | | grace days that is | | | | applicable to the | | | | loan. Grace Days | | | | pertain to the days | | | | after the Due Date | | | | during which penalty | | | | interest is not | | | | posted. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Floating Base Rate | | Select the base rate | | Table ID | | table ID from the | | | | dropdown list. It is | | | | applied when the | | | | transaction uses | | | | floating rate. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The available tables | | | | are maintained in the | | | | eLOAN Rate Table | | | | functions of the | | | | Standing Data module. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Floating Base Rate | | Select the base rate | | Number | | number from the | | | | dropdown list. This | | | | indicates which | | | | specific base rate | | | | number from the base | | | | rate table is to be | | | | used for the | | | | transaction. It is | | | | applied when the | | | | transaction uses | | | | floating rate. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Floating Spread | | Select the spread | | Rate Table ID | | rate table Id from | | | | the dropdown list. It | | | | is applied when the | | | | transaction uses | | | | spread rate. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The available tables | | | | are maintained in the | | | | eLOAN Rate Table | | | | functions of the | | | | Standing Data module. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Floating Spread | | Select the spread | | Rate Number | | rate number from the | | | | dropdown list. This | | | | indicates which | | | | specific spread rate | | | | number from the base | | | | rate table is to be | | | | used for the | | | | transaction. It is | | | | applied when the | | | | transaction uses | | | | spread rate. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | Specify the | | | | 4-character code of | | | | the module with which | | | | the transaction is to | | | | be associated. This | | | | is used for tracking | | | | the origin of the | | | | loan in case it is | | | | connected to other | | | | trade transactions or | | | | modules. | | | | | | | | The value of this | | | | field is the Short | | | | Module name of the | | | | business transaction | | | | (IA_C_MODU_NAME), | | | | which is required for | | | | the eLOAN | | | | accrual/amortization | | | | process. Either a | | | | fixed value may be | | | | specified to | | | | IA_C_MODU_NAME, or | | | | a transaction field | | | | may be mapped to the | | | | IA_C_MODU_NAME | | | | that is defined in | | | | the Accrual Takedown | | | | function of the eLOAN | | | | Transaction Module. | | | | The specific mode is | | | | decided by project. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Base Days | | This field is used in | | | | calculating interests | | | | on the basis of | | | | interest accrual. | | | | | | | | If no value is | | | | specified, the system | | | | automatically | | | | retrieves the Base | | | | Days value of the | | | | transaction currency | | | | code. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Auto Debit Flag | | Indicate whether the | | | | payment for the loan | | | | interest is to be | | | | automatically debited | | | | from the customer’s | | | | account during | | | | posting. The setting | | | | may be one of the | | | | following: | | | | | | | | - No | | | | | | | | - Yes | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Due Date | | Specify the date on | | | | which the loan | | | | principal or interest | | | | must be completely | | | | paid. The date may be | | | | defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Book Transaction | | Specify the book | | Amount | | value of bonds. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Last Coupon Payment | | Specify the Last | | Date | | Coupon Payment before | | | | eLOAN Accrual | | | | Takedown event, based | | | | on the specified | | | | coupon type. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | i. The Last Coupon | | | | Payment Ddate | | | | must be earlier | | | | than or the same | | | | date as the | | | | Transaction Value | | | | Date. | | | | | | | | ii. Refer to the | | | | [Coupon Payment | | | | Frequency | | | | Format](#coupon_p | | | | ymt_freq_format) | | | | discussion for | | | | more details on | | | | the format to | | | | which the coupon | | | | payment frequency | | | | is specified | | | | using the values | | | | specified in this | | | | field (Last | | | | Coupon Payment | | | | Date) and the | | | | Coupon Type | | | | field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Payment Schedule | | Select the payment | | Type | | schedule type: | | | | Schedule Interest | | | | Only. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | [NOTE: | | | | ]{.underline} | | | | | | | | There are several | | | | types of payment | | | | schedules. (Fix | | | | Principal, Fix | | | | Tenor[Formula | | | | Principal + | | | | Interest], | | | | Percentage Principal | | | | + Interest, Fix | | | | Amount, Increasing | | | | Principal, Decreasing | | | | Principal). | | | | Currently, the | | | | Schedule Interest | | | | Only payment schedule | | | | type is supported. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Coupon Type | | This field – | | | | together with the | | | | Last Coupon Payment | | | | Date – is used to | | | | specify the Coupon | | | | Payment Frequency | | | | through the CMNN | | | | format. | | | | | | | | For | | | | premium/discount | | | | interest accrual | | | | calculation, this | | | | field is mandatory. | | | | For other cases, this | | | | is field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | The following options | | | | are available in the | | | | dropdown list: | | | | | | | | - Annual - On a | | | | specified day of | | | | specified months | | | | in a year | | | | | | | | - Semi-Annual - On | | | | a specified day | | | | of specified | | | | semiannual months | | | | | | | | - Quarterly - On a | | | | specified day of | | | | specified months | | | | in a quarter | | | | | | | | - Bi-Monthly - On a | | | | specified day, | | | | once two months | | | | | | | | - Monthly - On a | | | | specified day, | | | | once a month | | | | | | | | - Weekly - On a | | | | specified day, | | | | once a week | | | | | | | | - Daily - Every day | | | | | | | | - At Maturity - The | | | | principal and | | | | interests are | | | | paid on the due | | | | date, and only | | | | one record of | | | | payment schedule | | | | is generated | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | Refer to the | | | | [Coupon Payment | | | | Frequency | | | | Format](#coupon_pymt_ | | | | freq_format) | | | | discussion for more | | | | details on the format | | | | to which the coupon | | | | payment frequency is | | | | specified using the | | | | values specified in | | | | this field (Coupon | | | | Type) and the Last | | | | Coupon Payment Date | | | | field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Amortize Flag** | | This field indicates | | | | that the current | | | | transaction is a | | | | premium/discount | | | | interest accrual | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | For the | | | | premium/discount | | | | interest accrual | | | | transactions, this | | | | field is mandatory. | | | | For other cases, this | | | | field is optional. | | | | | | | | The following options | | | | are available in the | | | | dropdown list: | | | | | | | | - No | | | | | | | | - Yes | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Delay Flag** | | This field is | | | | *reserved for future | | | | use.* | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **First Hand | | This refers to the | | Interest** | | calculated first hand | | | | interest of the loan | | | | which is calculated | | | | from the last | | | | interest date to the | | | | day before the | | | | Accrual Takedown | | | | value date based on | | | | the specified account | | | | type. To calculate | | | | this amount, click on | | | | the Get Int button. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | **Refer to the | | | | succeeding [First | | | | Hand | | | | Interest](#first_hand | | | | _int) | | | | discussion for more** | | | | details **on the | | | | required settings to | | | | calculate the first | | | | hand interest.** | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Account Level** | | This refer s to the | | | | account level to be | | | | appended into the | | | | account number for | | | | eLOAN voucher. This | | | | setting only takes | | | | effect if the eLOAN | | | | system parameters | | | | IA_GL_INTF_BANK_N | | | | AME | | | | and | | | | IA_ACCOUNTNO_MODULI | | | | ST | | | | are set. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Convention Roll** | | Specify the behavior | | | | of the value date. | | | | This field provides | | | | the following option | | | | values: | | | | | | | | - Modified | | | | Following: The | | | | value date is | | | | postponed into | | | | the next business | | | | date, and cannot | | | | cross into the | | | | succeeding month. | | | | If the value date | | | | is on the last | | | | date of the | | | | current month, | | | | this date is | | | | rolled back into | | | | the previous | | | | month instead. | | | | | | | | - Following: The | | | | value date is | | | | postponed into | | | | the next business | | | | date, and cannot | | | | cross into the | | | | succeeding month. | | | | | | | | - Modified | | | | Preceding: The | | | | value date is | | | | rolled back into | | | | the latest | | | | business date. | | | | However, if the | | | | value date is | | | | rolled back into | | | | the latest | | | | business date, | | | | and this date is | | | | on the last | | | | month, the value | | | | date is rolled | | | | back. to the next | | | | business date of | | | | the current | | | | month. | | | | | | | | - Preceding: The | | | | value date is | | | | rolled back into | | | | the latest | | | | business date. | | | | | | | | - End-of-Month: The | | | | value date is the | | | | last business | | | | date of the | | | | end-of-month. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Country List** | | This is used to | | | | retrieve the holiday | | | | details based on the | | | | user-specified | | | | country list. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional and is only | | | | used if the | | | | Convention Roll field | | | | is set to Modified | | | | Following. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Transaction Code** | | This field is used | | | | for specific purposes | | | | during posting. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Customer Code** | | This field is used | | | | for specific purposes | | | | during posting. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Purpose ID** | | This field is for | | | | *special projects | | | | only.* | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Form ID** | | This field is for | | | | *special projects | | | | only.* | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Coupon Day** | | Specify the original | | | | Coupon day in this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Total Payable | | This indicates the | | Interest** | | total payable | | | | interest. Click on | | | | the Get Payable | | | | Interest button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field to display the | | | | system calculated | | | | value, which is | | | | calculated as: Daily | | | | Interest * Days. | | | | | | | | Days pertain to the | | | | number of days from | | | | the accrual takedown | | | | value date to the due | | | | date. | | | | | | | | The daily interest is | | | | calculated as: | | | | | | | | Daily Interest = | | | | Takedown Amount * | | | | (Fixed Base Rate + | | | | Fixed Spread Rate)% / | | | | Base Days | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | | | | | | | | **[EXAMPLE:]{.underli | | | | ne}** | | | | | | | | Fixed Base Rate: 5.3\ | | | | Fixed Spread Rate: | | | | 2.6\ | | | | Accrual Takedown | | | | Value Date: | | | | 2020-03-08\ | | | | Transaction Due Date: | | | | 2020-03-13\ | | | | Takedown Amount: | | | | 10,000.00 USD\ | | | | Base Days: 365 | | | | | | | | Daily Interest = | | | | 10,000* (5.3 + 2.6)% | | | | / 365 = 2.16438356 | | | | | | | | Total Payable | | | | Interest = 2.16438356 | | | | * 5 = | | | | 10.82*(191780)* | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The italicized value | | | | pertains to the | | | | interest adjustment | | | | used by the system in | | | | the background | | | | calculation. It is | | | | not displayed on the | | | | screen. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Base Payable | | This indicates the | | Interest** | | payable interest | | | | excluding the | | | | interest spread. | | | | | | | | Click on the Get | | | | Payable Interest | | | | button to display the | | | | system calculated | | | | value. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | | | | | | | | **[EXAMPLE:]{.underli | | | | ne}** | | | | | | | | Fixed Base Rate: 5.3\ | | | | Accrual Takedown | | | | Value Date: | | | | 2020-03-08\ | | | | Transaction Due Date: | | | | 2020-03-13\ | | | | Accrual Takedown | | | | Amount: 10,000.00 | | | | USD\ | | | | Base Days: 365 | | | | | | | | Daily Interest = | | | | 10,000* 5.3% / 365 = | | | | 1.45205479 | | | | | | | | Base Payable Interest | | | | = 1.45205479 * 5 = | | | | 7.26*(027395)* | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The italicized value | | | | pertains to the | | | | interest adjustment | | | | used by the system in | | | | the background | | | | calculation. It is | | | | not displayed on the | | | | screen. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Penalty Payable | | This pertains to the | | Interest** | | penalty interest that | | | | applies to the | | | | transaction. At this | | | | stage of the | | | | transaction, this is | | | | 0. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | []{#coupon_pymt_freq_format .anchor}Coupon Payment Frequency Format | | | | The values specified in the Last Coupon Payment Date and Coupon Type | | fields in the Accrual Takedown function are used to specify the | | Coupon Payment Frequency, by using the ‘CMNN’ format. The following | | table illustrates the process of using this format. | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Coupon | Detail | C | M | NN | Descri | | | | Frequenc | s | | | | ption | | | | y | | | | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Annual | JAN | Y | 1 | 01-31(Sp | On a | | | | | | | | ecify | specifie | | | | | | | | the day | d | | | | | | | | of the | day of | | | | | | | | month) | specifie | | | | | | | | | d | | | | | | | | | months | | | | | | | | | in a | | | | | | | | | year | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | FEB | Y | 2 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | MAR | Y | 3 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | APR | Y | 4 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | MAY | Y | 5 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | JUN | Y | 6 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | JUL | Y | 7 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | AUG | Y | 8 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | SEP | Y | 9 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | OCT | Y | A | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | NOV | Y | B | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | DEC | Y | C | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Semi-Ann | JAN JUL | H | 1 | 01-31(Sp | On a | | | | ual | | | | ecify | specifie | | | | | | | | the day | d | | | | | | | | of the | day of | | | | | | | | month) | specifie | | | | | | | | | d | | | | | | | | | semiannu | | | | | | | | | al | | | | | | | | | months | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | FEB AUG | H | 2 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | MAR SEP | H | 3 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | APR OCT | H | 4 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | MAY NOV | H | 5 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | JUN DEC | H | 6 | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Quarterl | JAN APR | Q | 1 | 01-31(Sp | On a | | | | y | JUL OCT | | | ecify | specifie | | | | | | | | the day | d | | | | | | | | of the | day of | | | | | | | | month) | specifie | | | | | | | | | d | | | | | | | | | months | | | | | | | | | in a | | | | | | | | | quarter | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | FEB MAY | Q | 2 | | | | | | | AUG NOV | | | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | MAR JUN | Q | 3 | | | | | | | SEP DEC | | | | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Bi-Month | | B | 0 | 01-31(Sp | On a | | | | ly | | | | ecify | specifie | | | | | | | | the day | d | | | | | | | | of the | day, | | | | | | | | month) | once two | | | | | | | | | months | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Monthly | | M | 0 | 01-31(Sp | On a | | | | | | | | ecify | specifie | | | | | | | | the day | d | | | | | | | | of the | day, | | | | | | | | month) | once a | | | | | | | | | month | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Weekly | | W | 0 | 01-31(Sp | On a | | | | | | | | ecify | specifie | | | | | | | | the day | d | | | | | | | | of the | day, | | | | | | | | month) | once a | | | | | | | | | week | | | | | | | | Weekly | | | | | | | | | Expressi | | | | | | | | | on: | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 01 – | | | | | | | | | Monday; | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 02 – | | | | | | | | | Tuesday; | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 03 – | | | | | | | | | Wednesda | | | | | | | | | y; | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 04 – | | | | | | | | | Thursday | | | | | | | | | ; | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 05 – | | | | | | | | | Friday; | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 06 – | | | | | | | | | Saturday | | | | | | | | | ; | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | 07 – | | | | | | | | | Sunday; | | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | Daily | | D | 0 | 01 | Every | | | | | | | | | day | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | At | | A | 0 | 0 | On the | | | | Maturity | | | | | due date | | | +———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+———-+ | | | | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | Coupon Type = Quarterly | | | | Last Coupon Payment Date = April 17, 2020 | | | | Scope of Months (Quarterly) = Mar – June / Sep-Dec | | | | The Format is CMNN: Q (Quarterly) + 3 (Mar-June/Sep-Dec) + 17 (April | | 17). | | | | Therefore, the coupon payment frequency is Q317. | | | | The coupon payment frequency that follows the CMNN format can be | | viewed when the specific accrual transaction is viewed by inquiring | | the eLOAN event details. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ————————— | | {width="4.7326727909011375in” heigh | | t="2.3743055555555554in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ————————— | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | []{#first_hand_int .anchor}First Hand Interest | | | | The first hand interest of the loan is calculated from the last | | interest date to the day before the Accrual Takedown value date, | | based on the specified account type. In order to calculate the | | accrued first hand interest, the following procedures must be | | performed: | | | | 1. Create a GAPI template with the following details: | | | | - Interface Name: 8014 | | | | - Transaction Type: Inquire | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | {width="4.84375in” height="2.27083333333333 | | 35in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | | | 2. Configure the GAPI Interface with the following details: | | | | - GAPI Type: EJB | | | | - Component Name: eLOAN EJB GAPI | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | {width="4.84375in” height="2.27083333333333 | | 35in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | | | 3. Add the following Send Tags to the GAPI template. | | | | GAPI Tag Name GAPI Tag Description M/O Type | | ———————– ————————– ———- | | IA_C_CPN_TYPE Coupon Type M | | IA_D_LAST_CPNDATE Last Coupon Payment Date M | | IA_C_ACCOUNT_TYPE Account Type M | | IA_D_TRX_VALDATE Transaction Value Date M | | IA_Y_TRX_AMT Transaction Amount M | | IA_C_CCY_CODE Currency Code M | | IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE Fixed Base Rate M | | IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE Fixed Spread Rate M | | IA_D_DUE_DATE Expiry Date M | | | | 4. Add the following Receive Tags to the GAPI template. | | | | GAPI Tag Name GAPI Tag Description M/O Type | | ——————- ———————- ———- | | IA_Y_REACC_INT Reaccrued Interest M | | | | {width="0.3333333333333333in” | | height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: If the tag IA_Y_TENOR_DAYS is | | added in the 8014 GAPI template on the Receive node, the number of | | tenor days − which are the days between the Last Coupon Date and | | Value Date, including weekends and holidays − is generated separately | | from the calculated first hand interest. | | | | 5. Define the required GAPI mapping setting based on the eLOAN | | Accrual Takedown function. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | {width="4.84375in” height="2.26041666666666 | | 65in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | | | 6. In the Calculation function of the EE Utility, add a module level | | calculation under the IAAC module using the method name | | SYM_IAAC_ACC_InqHandGapi. Use the SYS_InqGapi system method | | to retrieve the relevant GAPI interface. | | | | > [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | > | | > SYS_InqGapi(‘eLOAN_Acc_InqHandInt’); | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | {width="4.84375in” height="2.26041666666666 | | 65in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | | | {width="0.3333333333333333in” | | height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the System Reference | | manual for more details regarding the SYS_InqGapi system method. | | | | 7. Generate the relevant XML files. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | {width="4.84375in” height="2.27083333333333 | | 35in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——– | | | | 8. During transaction processing, when defining the details of the | | Accrual Takedown transaction, and the Get Int button in the First | | Hand Interest field is clicked, the first hand interest is | | calculated. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ————————– | | {width="4.833333333333333in” height | | ="2.3489588801399823in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ————————– | +———————————————————————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | Payable Interest | | | | The system calculates three payable interest values: total, base, and | | penalty. These depend on the defined base rate, spread rate, and | | penalty rate. | | | | In order for the system to calculate the payable interests, the | | following procedures must be performed: | | | | 1. Create a GAPI template with the following details: | | | | - Interface Name: 8012 | | | | - Transaction Type: Inquire | | | | > {width="4.59375in” | | > height="2.437001312335958in”} | | | | 2. Configure the GAPI Interface with the following details: | | | | - GAPI Type: EJB | | | | - Component Name: eLOAN EJB GAPI | | | | > {width="4.59375in” | | > height="2.437001312335958in”} | | | | 3. Add the following Send Tags to the GAPI template. | | | | GAPI Tag Name GAPI Tag Description M/O Type | | ————————- ———————— ———- | | C_UNIT_CODE Unit Code M | | IA_C_ACCOUNT_TYPE Account Type M | | IA_C _AUTODBT_FLG Auto Debit Flag M | | IA_C_BORROWER_ID Borrower ID M | | IA_C_CCY_CODE Currency Code M | | IA_C_CREATE_BY Create By M | | IA_C_CREATE_FROM Create From M | | IA_C_CUST_CODE Customer Code O | | IA_C_FLT_RAT_TBLID Floating Rate Table ID O | | IA_C_FUNCTION_ID Function ID M | | IA_C_INTF_ID eLOAN GAPI Interface M | | IA_C_MODU_NAME Module Name M | | IA_C_REF_NO Reference No. M | | IA_C_SPR_ RAT_TBLID Spread Rate Table ID O | | IA_C_TRANS_CODE eLOAN Trx Code O | | IA_D_CREATE_DATE Create Date M | | IA_D_DUE_DATE Expiry Date M | | IA_D_TRX_VALDATE Transaction Value Date M | | IA_I_BASE_DAYS Base Days M | | IA_I_CCY_DEC Currency Code Decimal M | | IA_I_ FLT_RATE_NO Floating Rate No. O | | IA_I_GRACE_DAYS Grace Days O | | IA_I_SPR_ RATE_NO Spread Rate No. O | | IA_N_BUSINESS_TAX Business Tax O | | IA_N_EXCH_RATE Exchange Rate M | | IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE Fixed Base Rate O | | IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE Fixed Spread Rate O | | IA_N_PEN_RATE Penalty Spread Rate O | | IA_N_STAMP_TAX Stamp Tax O | | IA_Y_PAID_INT Paid Interest M | | IA_Y_TRX_AMT Transaction Amount M | | | | 4. Add the following Receive Tags to the GAPI template. | | | | GAPI Tag Name GAPI Tag Description M/O Ty | | pe | | ———————- ————————————- —— | | —- | | IA_Y_BAS_DEF_INT Calculated Base Payable Interest M | | IA_Y_PEN_DEF_INT Calculated Penalty Payable Interest M | | IA_Y_TTL_DEF_INT Calculated Total Payable Interest M | | | | 5. Create this GAPI rule: eLOAN_Acc_InqPayableInt. | | | | > {width="4.61724956255468in” | | > height="2.4494674103237095in”} | | > | | > {width="4.607665135608049in” | | > height="2.4443832020997376in”} | | > | | > {width="4.640018591426072in” | | > height="1.5279997812773403in”} | | > | | > {width="4.639583333333333in” | | > height="0.616081583552056in”} | | | | 6. In the Calculation function of the EE Utility, add a module level | | calculation called ACC_InqPayableIntGapi in the IAAC module | | using the method name SYM_IAAC_ACC_InqGapi. Use the | | SYS_InqGapi system method to retrieve the relevant GAPI | | interface. | | | | > [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | > | | > SYS_InqGapi(‘eLOAN_Acc_InqPayableInt’) | | > | | > {width="4.662338145231846in” | | > height="0.9664785651793526in”} | | | | +——————————————————————+ | | | > {width="4.69367782152231in” | | | | > height="0.9415583989501313in”} | | | +——————————————————————+ | | | | > {width="4.687778871391076in” | | > height="0.9480216535433071in”} | | | | {width="0.3333333333333333in” | | height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the System Reference | | manual for more details regarding the SYS_InqGapi system method. | | | | 7. Generate the relevant XML files. | | | | {width="3.642856517935258in” | | height="3.2480260279965005in”} | | | | 8. During transaction processing, when defining the details of the | | Accrual Takedown transaction, the following payable interests are | | calculated when the Get Payable Interest button in the Total | | Payable Interest field is clicked: | | | | - Total Payable Interest | | | | - Base Payable Interest | | | | - Penalty Payable Interest | | | | ——————————————————————- | | —————– | | {width="4.337662948381452in” height="2.2887 | | 00787401575in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | —————– | +———————————————————————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image73.p | | following function: | | ng){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Accrual | | | | Functions > Accrual | | | | TakeDown | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The Accrual | | ![](./media/image74.p | | Takedown function | | ng){width="3.5in” | | screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Specify the relevant | | | | details in the fields | | | | provided. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Click on the | | ![](./media/image75.p | | Confirm button on | | ng){width="3.5in” | | the toolbar. | | height="5.34722222222 | | | | 2222e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image76.p | | Completed screen is | | ng){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

{#section-9 .CS-head1}

Accrual Payment

This function is used for processing the payment of a loan transaction’s Principal, Pay Interest, or Pay Principal and Interest. In a loan transaction:

  • Pay Principal indicates that only the Transaction Amount is greater than 0.

  • Pay Interest indicates that only the Paid Interest Amount is greater than 0.

  • Pay Principal and Interest indicates that both the Transaction Amount and Paid Interest Amount are greater than 0.

Figure 3. 2 Accrual Payment Function

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | This is the unique | | | | reference number of | | | | the selected | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This refers to the | | | | business unit for | | | | which the transaction | | | | is made. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | This field refers to | | | | the module that is | | | | associated with the | | | | transaction. This is | | | | used for tracking the | | | | origin of the loan in | | | | case it is connected | | | | to other trade | | | | transactions or | | | | modules. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction Value | | This refers to the | | Date | | date on which the | | | | transaction is made. | | | | This must not be | | | | later than the | | | | initial takedown date | | | | of the transaction. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction | | This refers to the | | Amount | | amount of the paid | | | | principal. The field | | | | must have a positive | | | | value and must not | | | | exceed the takedown | | | | amount for Pay | | | | Principal | | | | (Transaction Amount | | | | is greater than 0) | | | | and Pay Principal | | | | &Interest process | | | | (Transaction Amount | | | | and Paid Interest | | | | Amount fields are | | | | greater than 0). | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | i. Pay Principal: | | | | The Transaction | | | | Amount is greater | | | | than 0. | | | | | | | | ii. Pay Principal & | | | | Interest: A | | | | positive value is | | | | specified both | | | | for Transaction | | | | Amount and Paid | | | | Interest Amount | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Paid Interest | | This refers to the | | Amount | | interest amount to be | | | | paid. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | This amount is not | | | | subtracted from the | | | | Transaction Amount. | | | | Instead, the | | | | Transaction Amount is | | | | the outstanding | | | | principal amount that | | | | is used for interest | | | | accrual. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Paid Base Interest | | Specify the base | | Amount | | interst amount that | | | | has already been | | | | paid. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Paid Spread | | Specify the spread | | Interest Amount | | interst amount that | | | | has already been | | | | paid. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Paid Penalty | | Specify the penalty | | Interest Amount | | interst amount that | | | | has already been paid | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Calculate From | | Specify the start | | Date | | date of the interest | | | | accrual. The date may | | | | be defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Calculate To Date | | Specify the end date | | | | of the interest | | | | accrual. The date may | | | | be defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Total Calculated | | This refers to the | | Interest | | total calculated | | | | interest from the | | | | indicated period.
