{#section-14 .CS-head1}

Amortization Rollback

This function is used for reversing all the eLOAN events performed up to a defined rollback date, thereby allowing the system to redo all the interest postings starting from this rollback date.

When a rollback event is processed for a transaction, the system marks this event as disabled; a flag is set to mark the transaction. However, the reversed eLOAN events are not removed from the system; a disabled event can still be inquired on.

The Amortization Rollback function can process the following events:

  • Re-Takedown

  • Payment

  • Extend and Shorten

  • Amend

Figure 4. 6 Amortization Rollback Function

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | This is the unique | | | | reference number of | | | | the selected | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This refers to the | | | | business unit for | | | | which the transaction | | | | is made. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | This field refers to | | | | the module that is | | | | associated with the | | | | transaction. This is | | | | used for tracking the | | | | origin of the loan in | | | | case it is connected | | | | to other trade | | | | transactions or | | | | modules. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction Value | | Specify the | | Date | | transaction value | | | | date. This must be | | | | the same as or later | | | | than the takedown | | | | date. The date may be | | | | defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Rollback Event | | Specify the number of | | No. | | the starting event | | | | for the rollback | | | | process. The event | | | | number can be | | | | determined by | | | | inquiring on the | | | | transaction and | | | | viewing all its event | | | | files. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account Type | | This refers to the | | | | account type for the | | | | Borrower. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image225. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Amortization | | | | Functions > | | | | Amortization Rollback | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The Amortization | | ![](./media/image226. | | Rollback function | | png){width="3.5in” | | catalog screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | To create the filter | | | | criteria for | | | | displaying records, | | | | specify the value for | | | | the Main Ref. No. | | | | (Main Reference | | | | Number) field. | | | | | | | | Click on the Next | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Select the | | ![](./media/image227. | | relevant record | | png){width="3.5in” | | from the list that | | height="1.72361111111 | | is displayed. Click | | 11112in”} | | on the Next button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The Amortization | | ![](./media/image228. | | Rollback function | | png){width="3.5in” | | screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Specify the relevant | | | | information. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | ![](./media/image229. | | ** | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.77358486439 | | The event number can | | 1951in”} | | be determined by | | | | inquiring on the | | | | transaction and | | | | viewing all its event | | | | files. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. Click on the | | ![](./media/image230. | | Confirm button on | | png){width="3.5in” | | the toolbar. | | height="5.06944444444 | | | | 44445e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image231. | | Completed screen is | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

{#section-15 .CS-head1}

Amortization Cancel

This function is used for cancelling an amortization loan transaction.

If the transaction value date for this cancellation is later than last posted date, the accounting entries remain the same. If the value date is earlier than the last posted date (i.e., Cancel with Back Valuation), the posted accounting entries are reversed until the last posted day of the Cancel event.

If the transaction value date is the Takedown date, the system reverses all the posted entries. Otherwise, the system posts non-amortized interests only.

A cancelled transaction can no longer be processed with any other event.

Figure 4. 7 Amortization Cancel Function

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | This is the unique | | | | reference number of | | | | the selected | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This refers to the | | | | business unit for | | | | which the transaction | | | | is made. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | This field refers to | | | | the module that is | | | | associated with the | | | | transaction. This is | | | | used for tracking the | | | | origin of the loan in | | | | case it is connected | | | | to other trade | | | | transactions or | | | | modules. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction Value | | Specify the | | Date | | transaction value | | | | date. This must be | | | | the same as or later | | | | than the takedown | | | | date. The date may be | | | | defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account Type | | This refers to the | | | | account type for the | | | | Borrower. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image233. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Amortization | | | | Functions > | | | | Amortization Cancel | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The Amortization | | ![](./media/image234. | | Cancel function | | png){width="3.5in” | | catalog screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | To create the filter | | | | criteria for | | | | displaying records, | | | | specify the value for | | | | the Main Ref. No. | | | | (Main Reference | | | | Number) field. | | | | | | | | Click on the Next | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Select the | | ![](./media/image235. | | relevant record | | png){width="3.5in” | | from the list that | | height="1.72361111111 | | is displayed. Click | | 11112in”} | | on the Next button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The Amortization | | ![](./media/image236. | | Cancel function | | png){width="3.5in” | | screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Specify the relevant | | | | information. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. Click on the | | ![](./media/image237. | | Confirm button on | | png){width="3.5in” | | the toolbar. | | height="5.34722222222 | | | | 2222e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image238. | | Completed screen is | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Amortization Change Penalty Rate

The penalty rate is added to the interest rate if the loan is not settled on the maturity date. The Amortization Change Penalty Rate function is used for changing this penalty rate given that the Amortization is not yet converted to an Accrual record (that uses an Accrual rate) automatically on or after Due Date.

Figure 4. 8 Amortization Change Penalty Rate Function

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | This is the unique | | | | reference number of | | | | the selected | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This refers to the | | | | business unit for | | | | which the transaction | | | | is made. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | This field refers to | | | | the module that is | | | | associated with the | | | | transaction. This is | | | | used for tracking the | | | | origin of the loan in | | | | case it is connected | | | | to other trade | | | | transactions or | | | | modules. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction Value | | Specify the | | Date | | transaction value | | | | date. This must be | | | | the same as or later | | | | than the takedown | | | | date. The date may be | | | | defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Penalty Rate | | Specify the new | | | | penalty rate. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | optional. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account Type | | This refers to the | | | | account type for the | | | | Borrower. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image240. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Amortization | | | | Functions > | | | | Amortization Change | | | | Penalty Rate | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. No. | | | | (Main Reference | | | | Number) field. | | | | | | | | Click on the Next | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Select the | | ![](./media/image242. | | relevant record | | png){width="3.5in” | | from the list that | | height="1.72361111111 | | is displayed. Click on the | | ![](./media/image244. | | Confirm button on | | png){width="3.5in” | | the toolbar. | | height="5.06944444444 | | | | 44445e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image245. | | Completed screen is | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Amortization Stop

This function is used for temporarily stopping the interest amortization and the posting of a transaction.

When a transaction has a ‘stopped’ status, any event can be processed without interest and posting.

Figure 4. 9 Amortization Stop Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. A stopped transaction may be restored using the Amortization Restart function (Restart event).

ii. If the last posted date is earlier than the transaction value date of the Stop event, the system continues to post until this date:
(Transaction Value Date of the Stop event - 1)

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | This is the unique | | | | reference number of | | | | the selected | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This refers to the | | | | business unit for | | | | which the transaction | | | | is made. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | This field refers to | | | | the module that is | | | | associated with the | | | | transaction. This is | | | | used for tracking the | | | | origin of the loan in | | | | case it is connected | | | | to other trade | | | | transactions or | | | | modules. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction Value | | Specify the | | Date | | transaction value | | | | date. This must be | | | | the same as or later | | | | than the takedown | | | | date. The date may be | | | | defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account Type | | This refers to the | | | | account type for the | | | | Borrower. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Amortization Restart

This function is used for restoring a ‘stopped’ transaction. Once the stopped transaction is restarted, the interest is amortized and posted beginning from the stopped value date.

Figure 4. 10 Amortization Restart Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: A transaction is stopped through the Amortization Stop function.

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | This is the unique | | | | reference number of | | | | the selected | | | | transaction. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This refers to the | | | | business unit for | | | | which the transaction | | | | is made. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | This field refers to | | | | the module that is | | | | associated with the | | | | transaction. This is | | | | used for tracking the | | | | origin of the loan in | | | | case it is connected | | | | to other trade | | | | transactions or | | | | modules. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Transaction Value | | Specify the | | Date | | transaction value | | | | date. This must be | | | | the same as or later | | | | than the takedown | | | | date. The date may be | | | | defined using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | mandatory. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account Type | | This refers to the | | | | account type for the | | | | Borrower. | | | | | | | | This field is | | | | protected. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. eLOAN Batch Functions

  • Introduction to THE eLOAN Batch Functions

  • eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual

  • eLOAN Batch Posting

  • eLOAN Pre Advice

  • eloan batch generate schedule

Introduction to the eLOAN Batch Functions

The following batch functions are used in eLOAN:

  • eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual

  • eLOAN Batch Posting

  • eLOAN Pre Advice

  • eLOAN Batch Generate Schedule

  • eLOAN Batch Tasks by Module

  • eLOAN Batch Before the Next Working Day

The eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual and eLOAN Batch Posting functions may be run automatically either per module or for all modules by creating user batch jobs. Refer to the eLOAN Batch Tasks by Module section.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Additional conditions may be configured through the Batch Manager function of the EE Utility to enable these system level eLOAN Batch functions to run based on specific project requirements. Refer to Appendix F: eLOAN Batch Settings for more information.

{#section-16 .CS-head1}

{#section-17 .CS-head1}

eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual

This batch function is used to trigger the eLOAN system to accrue all the transactions of a process center and its branches. The system also checks for holidays and non-business dates before processing the computations for interest accrual.

Figure 5. 1 eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Accrual Date | | This refers to the | | | | date on which the | | | | accrual batch process | | | | is run. This defaults | | | | to the system date. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | If this date is set | | | | to less than one year | | | | away from the last | | | | Schedule To date of | | | | the accrual, schedule | | | | and premium/discount | | | | data are generated | | | | continuously up to | | | | the end date based on | | | | the value specified | | | | in the | | | | IA_SCHEDULE_PERIOD | | | | parameter. Refer to | | | | [Appendix B: eLOAN | | | | System | | | | Parameters](#appb_elo | | | | ansysparam) | | | | for more information | | | | on this system | | | | parameter. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Parent Unit | | This is the parent | | | | unit or process | | | | center for which the | | | | batch process is to | | | | be run. | | | | | | | | To execute the | | | | process for this | | | | parent unit and all | | | | its branches, select | | | | the corresponding | | | | flag. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This section lists | | | | all the branches | | Unit Name | | under the process | | | | center. Select the | | | | branches for which | | | | the batch process is | | | | to be run. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | To run the batch | | | | process only for a | | | | specific module, mark | | | | this flag and select | | | | the module from the | | | | dropdown list. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | To run the batch | | | | process only for | | From | | specific | | | | transactions, mark | | To | | the Reference No | | | | flag. In the From and | | | | To fields, specify | | | | the relevant | | | | reference numbers to | | | | indicate the range of | | | | transactions to be | | | | processed. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image261. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Batch Functions | | | | > eLOAN Batch | | | | Interest Accrual | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The eLOAN Batch | | ![](./media/image262. | | Interest Accrual | | png){width="3.5in” | | function screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Define the relevant | | | | settings. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Click on the | | ![](./media/image263. | | Confirm button on | | png){width="3.5in” | | the toolbar. | | height="5.34722222222 | | | | 2222e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image264. | | Completed screen is | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

eLOAN Batch Posting

This batch function is used to post the eLOAN system computations for the different transactions in the database.

The following rules are implemented by the system during this batch process.

  1. The posting frequency, based on the Account Type settings, is followed.

  2. The Payment (Pay Interest Only, Pay Principal & Interest), Refund interest, Change Account Type, Stop, and Cancel events are executed. The system generates the record where:

    • From Date = Last Posting Date + 1 day

    • To Date = Transaction Value Date - 1 day

  3. There are no pending events.

There are two posting entries that are generated daily. One is related to the coupon posted interest with the post type ‘A’, which is generated after the Batch Interest Accrual is run. Another is related to the amortization for premium posted amount with the post type ‘P’, or discount posted amount with the post type ‘L’.

Once this batch function is run, the eLOAN system generates voucher information automatically. Refer to the Enquire eLOAN Voucher function discussion in Chapter Six for more details.

Figure 5. 2 Example: Posting Entries

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The Posted Code column may contain any of the following values:

I – Paid Interest Event

F – Refund Interest Event

N - Normal

R - Rollback

P – Penalty

ii. If the value of the IA_GET_EXCH_RATE_FLAG is set to 0, the exchange rate is retrieved by the system based on the value of the IA_N_EXCH_RATE field. However, if the value of the IA_GET_EXCH_RATE_FLAG is set to 1, the exchange rate is retrieved by the system based on the exchage rate specified in the related account type setting. Thus, If the exchange rate conversion of the transaction currency to the local currency is not defined in the eLOAN Account Type, an exception is encountered and recorded in the logs once the eLOAN Batch Posting function is run. Vouchers are also not generated for the records in the same batch processing.

[EXAMPLE:]{.underline}

The closing exchange rate specified in the transaction from HKD to USD is not recorded in the database. An exception message is then recorded in the relevant error log.

{width="4.927083333333333in” height="0.9375in”}

Figure 5. 3 eLOAN Batch Posting Function

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Posting Date | | This refers to the | | | | date on which the | | | | posting batch process | | | | is run. This defaults | | | | to the system date. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Parent Unit | | This is the parent | | | | unit or process | | | | center for which the | | | | batch process is to | | | | be run. | | | | | | | | To execute the | | | | process for this | | | | parent unit and all | | | | its branches, select | | | | the corresponding | | | | flag. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This section lists | | | | all the branches | | Unit Name | | under the process | | | | center. Select the | | | | branches for which | | | | the batch process is | | | | to be run. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | To run the batch | | | | process only for a | | | | specific module, mark | | | | this flag and select | | | | the module from the | | | | dropdown list. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Reference No | | To run the batch | | | | process only for | | From | | specific | | | | transactions, mark | | To | | the Reference No | | | | flag. In the From and | | | | To fields, specify | | | | the relevant | | | | reference numbers to | | | | indicate the range of | | | | transactions to be | | | | processed. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image268. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Batch Functions | | | | > eLOAN Batch | | | | Posting | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The eLOAN Batch | | ![](./media/image269. | | Posting function | | png){width="3.5in” | | screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Define the relevant | | | | settings. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Click on the | | ![](./media/image270. | | Confirm button on | | png){width="3.5in” | | the toolbar. | | height="4.30555555555 | | | | 55555e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image271. | | Completed screen is | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

eLOAN Pre Advice

This function is used for generating a pre-advice on the amount of interest accrued or amount to be paid for a specified period. This allows the user to inquire on the interests being earned for specific transactions within the given period.

Figure 5. 4 eLOAN Pre Advice Function

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: If a transaction has been paid off on a date that is within the specified From and To dates in the Pre Advice function, this transaction is included in the processing of pre-advice. The interest amount for this transaction is calculated from the pre-advice start date up to the transaction's pay off date.

Configuration

This function provides the following fields.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | From Date | | Specify the start | | | | date of the period. | | | | This defaults to the | | | | start date of the | | | | current month. | | | | | | | | The default date may | | | | be modfiied using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. The new From | | | | Date must be equal or | | | | earlier than the | | | | defined To Date. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | To Date | | Specify the end date | | | | of the period. This | | | | defaults to the end | | | | date of the current | | | | month. | | | | | | | | The default date may | | | | be modified using the | | | | calendar function | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Detail List | | This section lists | | | | the conditions for | | | | calculating the | | | | interest and amounts | | | | incurred within the | | | | indicated period. | | | | | | | | To define a | | | | condition, click on | | | | the Add button and | | | | specify the required | | | | parameters in the | | | | General Inquire | | | | Information window | | | | that is displayed. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

In the General Inquire Information window, the conditions for calculating the interest and amounts incurred within the indicated period may be defined.

Figure 5. 5 eLOAN Pre-Advice Function: General Inquire Information Window

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Relation | | This field lists the | | | | available relational | | | | operators that are | | | | used to pair or | | | | combine different | | | | conditions. These | | | | are: | | | | | | | | - AND | | | | | | | | - OR | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | FieldName | | Select the field to | | | | be used in defining | | | | the condition. The | | | | following are the | | | | available fields in | | | | the dropdown list: | | | | | | | | - Reference No | | | | (IA_C_REF_NO) | | | | | | | | - Unit Code | | | | (C_UNIT_CODE) | | | | | | | | - Module Name | | | | (IA_C_MODU_NAM | | | | E) | | | | | | | | - Borrower ID | | | | (IA_C_BORROWER\ | | | | _ID) | | | | | | | | - Currency Code | | | | (IA_C_CCY_CODE | | | | ) | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Position | | This is used to | | | | define the start | | | | position of the field | | | | search condition. | | | | This must be used | | | | together with the | | | | Length property. | | | | | | | | [EXAMPLE:]{.underli | | | | ne} | | | | | | | | If the Reference No | | | | (Acc000234567) is | | | | used as the | | | | condition, 3 as the | | | | position and 5 as the | | | | length, the scope to | | | | be used in filter, | | | | which counting starts | | | | from 0, is “00023”. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Length | | This is used to | | | | define the length of | | | | the field search | | | | condition starting | | | | from the value | | | | specified in the | | | | Position field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Operand | | This field lists all | | | | the available SQL | | | | operands that may be | | | | used for value | | | | comparison. These | | | | are: | | | | | | | | - = | | | | | | | | - > | | | | | | | | - >= | | | | | | | | - < | | | | | | | | - <= | | | | | | | | - <> | | | | | | | | - like | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Value | | Specify the relevant | | | | value of the selected | | | | Field Name. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image274. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Batch Functions | | | | > eLOAN PreAdvice | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The eLOAN Pre | | ![](./media/image275. | | Advice function | | png){width="3.5in” | | screen is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Define the From and | | | | To dates. | | | | | | | | Click on the Add | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. In the General | | ![](./media/image276. | | Inquire Information | | png){width="3.5in” | | window, specify the | | height="2.23263888888 | | conditions for | | 8889in”} | | calculating the | | | | interest and | | | | amounts incurred | | | | within the | | | | indicated period. | | | | | | | | Click on the Save | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The specified | | ![](./media/image277. | | settings are | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. Click on the | | ![](./media/image278. | | Confirm button on | | png){width="3.5in” | | the toolbar. | | height="4.30555555555 | | | | 55555e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image279. | | Completed screen is | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

eLOAN Batch Generate Schedule

This function is used for generating the schedule and premium/discount information in the specified time period.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The system parameter IA_SCHEDULE_PERIOD must be added to generate the schedule information.

Figure 5. 6 eLOAN Batch Generate Schedule Function

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Schedule To Date | | This refers to the | | | | schedule To date. The | | | | schedule information | | | | is generated from the | | | | current date up to | | | | the date that is | | | | specified in this | | | | field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Parent Unit | | This is the parent | | | | unit or process | | | | center for which the | | | | batch process is to | | | | be run. | | | | | | | | To execute the | | | | process for this | | | | parent unit and all | | | | its branches, select | | | | the corresponding | | | | flag. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Unit Code | | This section lists | | | | all the branches | | Unit Name | | under the process | | | | center. Select the | | | | branches for which | | | | the batch process is | | | | to be run. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Module Name | | To run the batch | | | | process only for a | | | | specific module, mark | | | | this flag and select | | | | the module from the | | | | dropdown list. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **Reference Number ** | | To run the batch | | | | process only for | | From | | specific | | | | transactions, mark | | To | | the Reference No | | | | flag. In the From and | | | | To fields, specify | | | | the relevant | | | | reference numbers to | | | | indicate the range of | | | | transactions to be | | | | processed. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | The eLOAN Batch Generate Schedule Function Configuration | | | | - Screen | | | | | | | | - [EximBillWeb.war | | > folder]/screen/eLOAN/IAAC_BatchGenSchedule.jsp | | | | > {width="4.707547025371828in” | | > height="0.817587489063867in”} | | | | - Attribute | | | | | | | | - Component Name: Trx Generate GAPI | | | | - Schema: SYS | | | | - Main Reference Number: C_MAIN_REF | | | | - Post/Inquire: P | | | | > {width="4.688680008748906in” | | > height="1.530637576552931in”} | | | | - Function | | | | | | | | - Function Name: eLOANBatchGenSched | | | | - Description: eLOAN Batch Generate Schedule | | | | - Main Program: eLOAN Control Manager | | | | - Short Name: eLOANBatchGenSch | | | | > {width="4.701298118985127in” | | > height="3.4838659230096236in”} | | | | - Function Group | | | | | | | | - eLOAN Batch Functions | | | | > {width="4.681213910761155in” | | > height="0.9867979002624672in”} | | | | - GAPI Settings | | | | > [GAPI Template]{.underline} | | | | - Interface Name: 8024 | | | | - Transaction Type: Release | | | | - GAPI Type: EJB | | | | - Component Name: eLOAN EJB GAPI | | | | - Send Tag: IA_D_SCHE_TODATE | | | | > {width="4.661774934383202in” | | > height="2.473088363954506in”} | | > | | > {width="4.661111111111111in” | | > height="2.472736220472441in”} | | > | | > [GAPI Mapping]{.underline} | | > | | > {width="4.661774934383202in” | | > height="2.473088363954506in”} | | > | | > [GAPI Parameter in Function Settings]{.underline} | | > | | > {width="4.73043416447944in” | | > height="2.5095122484689414in”} | | | | - XML Generation | | | | | | | | - Generate the XML file for the parameters Screen, Attribute, | | > Function, GAPI, Function Group, and Calculation (For the | | > Default JS file). | | | | > {width="4.679245406824147in” | | > height="2.4823567366579176in”} | +———————————————————————–+

Procedure

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | ![](./media/image290. | | ** | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | In this sample | | 11112in”} | | procedure, the value | | | | of the | | | | IA_SCHEDULE_PERIOD | | | | system parameter is | | | | set to 1 (year). The | | | | accrual transaction | | | | is set to 4 years | | | | (2020-2024). | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | In the Inquire | | ![](./media/image291. | | Accrual Transaction | | png){width="3.5in” | | function, use the | | height="1.72361111111 | | Schedule and Pre/Dis | | 11112in”} | | buttons to view the | | | | schedule and | | | | premium/discount | | | | details. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The schedule | | ![](./media/image292. | | information generated | | png){width="3.5in” | | is only for 1 year. | | height="1.78199146981 | | (2020-2021). | | 62729in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The generated | | ![](./media/image293. | | premium/discount | | png){width="3.5in” | | information is only | | height="1.77251202974 | | for one year. | | 62817in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image294. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Batch Functions | | | | > Batch Generate | | | | Schedule | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The eLOAN Batch | | ![](./media/image295. | | Generate Schedule | | png){width="3.5in” | | function screen is | | height="1.81805555555 | | displayed. | | 55555in”} | | | | | | Define the relevant | | | | settings. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Click on the | | ![](./media/image296. | | Confirm button when | | png){width="3.5in” | | done. | | height="5.06944444444 | | | | 44445e-2in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The Transaction | | ![](./media/image297. | | Completed screen is | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.81805555555 | | | | 55555in”} | | To run the function | | | | again, click on the | | | | Continue option. | | | | | | | | To exit the function, | | | | click on the Cancel | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | ![](./media/image298. | | ** | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.85520341207 | | View the relevant | | 34908in”} | | transaction in the | | | | Enquire Accrual | | | | Transactions | | | | function. Click on | | | | the Schedule button. | | | | | | | | The Takedown | | | | transaction is set as | | | | ‘Quarterly’, | | | | therefore, the last | | | | Tenor generated in | | | | the Schedule To Date | | | | is the quarter to | | | | which the specified | | | | date on the Schedule | | | | To field in the eLOAN | | | | Batch Generate | | | | Schedule function is | | | | included. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | ![](./media/image299. | | ** | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.84615376202 | | View the relevant | | 97463in”} | | transaction in the | | | | Enquire Accrual | | | | Transactions | | | | function. Click on | | | | the Pre/Dis button. | | | | | | | | The Takedown | | | | transaction is set as | | | | ‘Quarterly’, | | | | therefore, the last | | | | Tenor generated in | | | | the Schedule To Date | | | | is the quarter to | | | | which the specified | | | | date on the Schedule | | | | To field in the eLOAN | | | | Batch Generate | | | | Schedule function is | | | | included. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————————————————————–+ | eLOAN Batch Tasks in Batch Manager | | | | To process eLOAN interest accrual, posting, or schedule generation | | tasks by batch, either the corresponding eLOAN batch functions in the | | eLOAN Transaction Module may be used, or these batch tasks may be set | | up in the Batch Manager function of the EE Utility. Batch tasks set | | up in the Batch Manager function are manually run, whereas batch | | processes run on the eLOAN Transaction Module are based on the | | relevant schedule. | | | | The following batch tasks are used in the Batch Manager: | | | | - IABatchIntAccTask | | | | - IABatchPostingTask | | | | - IABatchGenerateSchedule | | | | [To add a System Batch Task:]{.underline} | | | | 1. Run the Batch Manager function of the EE Utility. In the System | | Batch node, select the AutoProcessTaskMgr task. To add the batch | | task for interest accrual, add the IABatchIntAccTask subtask with | | the following details: | | | | - Sub Task Name: IABatchIntAccTask | | | | - Sub Task Desc: IABatchIntAccTask | | | | - Initial Status: End | | | | - Class Name: IABatchIntAccTask | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——— | | {width="4.84375in” height="2.4270833333333 | | 335in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——— | | | | 2. To add the batch task for posting, add the IABatchPostingTask | | subtask to the AutoProcessTaskMgr task with the following | | details: | | | | - Sub Task Name: IABatchPostingTask | | | | - Sub Task Desc: IABatchPostingTask | | | | - Initial Status: End | | | | - Class Name: IABatchPostingTask | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——— | | {width="4.84375in” height="2.4270833333333 | | 335in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——— | | | | 3. To add the batch task for generating schedule, add the | | IABatchGenerateSchedule subtask to the AutoProcessTaskMgr task | | with the following details: | | | | - Sub Task Name: IABatchGenerateSchedule | | | | - Sub Task Desc: IABatchGenerateSchedule | | | | - Initial Status: End | | | | - Class Name: IABatchGenerateSchedule | | | | ———————————————————– | | {width="3.94in” height="3.94in”} | | ———————————————————– | | | | [To add a User Batch Task:]{.underline} | | | | 1. Batch Manager function of the EE Utility, select the User Batch | | node. Right-click on the index of User Batch tasks and select the | | Add option from the popup menu that is displayed. | | | | – | | – | | | | 2. In the Job Setting window, specify the job name and description | | and set the job type to Manual. Click on the Task tab. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————– | | {width="4.3526815398075245in” height="3.07 | | 02777777777777in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————– | | | | 3. In the Task tab, click on the Add button to add a task. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | —- | | {width="4.4in” height="3.103655949256343in | | “} | | ——————————————————————- | | —- | | | | 4. In the Task Property tab of the Task Setting window, specify the | | following details name and description of the | | ELOANBatchIntAccTask. Select the batch task IABatchintAccTask | | from the Task Component dropdown list. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | {width="4.854166666666667in” height="3.635 | | 4166666666665in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | | | 5. In the Catalog tab, configure the selection criteria to be used | | in running the task. Click on the OK button when done. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | {width="4.600470253718285in” height="3.445 | | 4166666666666in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | | | 6. The name and description of the created task is displayed. Click | | on the Add button to add another task. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | —————— | | {width="4.616920384951881in” height="3.256 | | 666666666667in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | —————— | | | | 7. In the Task Property tab of the Task Setting window, specify the | | following details name and description of the | | ELOANBatchIntPostingTask. Select the batch task | | IABatchPostingTask from the Task Component dropdown list. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | —– | | {width="4.419657699037621in” height="3.31i | | n”} | | ——————————————————————- | | —– | | | | 8. In the Catalog tab, configure the selection criteria to be used | | in running the task. Click on the OK button when done. | | | | {width="4.326188757655293in” | | height="3.24in”} | | | | 9. The name and description of the created task is displayed. Click | | on the Add button to add another task. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | —– | | {width="4.664174321959755in” height="3.29i | | n”} | | ——————————————————————- | | —– | | | | 10. In the Task Property tab of the Task Setting window, specify the | | following details name and description of the | | ELOANBatchGenerateSchedule. Select the batch task | | IABatchGenerateSchedule from the Task Component dropdown list. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | —————— | | {width="4.514853455818023in” height="3.274 | | 722222222222in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | —————— | | | | 11. In the Catalog tab, configure the selection criteria to be used | | in running the task. Click on the OK button when done. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | {width="4.480298556430446in” height="3.355 | | 4166666666667in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | | | 12. The name and description of the created task is displayed. Click | | on the Save button to store the configurations. Restart the | | application server. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | —– | | {width="4.47in” height="3.081360454943132i | | n”} | | ——————————————————————- | | —– | | | | 13. Log on the EE browser and run the User Batch Manager function of | | the System Maintenance function group. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ———————————– | | {width="4.854166666666667i | | n” height="2.8541666666666665in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ———————————– | | | | 14. In the index of User Batch jobs, select the created eLOAN job and | | then click on the Start button to start the tasks. | | | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | {width="4.088221784776903in” height="3.349 | | 0562117235347in”} | | ——————————————————————- | | ——————- | | | | {width="0.3333333333333333in” | | height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: | | | | i. Refer to the Utility Reference: Transaction Functions manual | | for more information on the Batch Manager function. | | | | ii. The eLOAN system retrieves the business date as the one of the | | condition for the eLOAN batch tasks. | | | | {width="4.09375in” height="2.21875in”} | | | | {width="4.104166666666667in” | | height="0.5729166666666666in”} | +———————————————————————–+

eLOAN Inquire Functions

  • Introduction to eLOAN Inquire Functions

  • Enquire Accrual Transaction

  • Enquire Amortization Transaction

  • Enquire eLOAN Voucher

{#section-18 .CS-head1}

{#section-19 .CS-head1}

{#section-20 .CS-head1}

Introduction to the eLOAN Inquire Functions

The eLOAN Inquire Functions group consists of the following inquiry functions:

  • Enquire Accrual Transaction

  • Enquire Amortization Transaction

  • Enquire eLOAN Voucher

Enquire Accrual Transaction

This function is used for enquiring an existing accrual transaction. No modification or change may be applied to the record through this function

The View, Event, Posting, and Accrual buttons are provided in this function. These are used to display the record details.

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image318. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Inquire | | | | Functions > Enquire | | | | Accrual Transaction | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The Enquire | | ![](./media/image319. | | Accrual Transaction | | png){width="3.5in” | | function catalog | | height="1.72361111111 | | screen is | | 11112in”} | | displayed. | | | | | | | | To create the filter | | | | criteria for | | | | displaying records, | | | | specify the value for | | | | the Reference No. | | | | field. | | | | | | | | Click on the Next | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Select the | | ![](./media/image320. | | relevant record | | png){width="3.5in” | | from the list that | | height="1.72361111111 | | is displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Six buttons are | | | | provided: View, Event | | | | A, Posting A, Accrual | | | | A, Schedule A, and | | | | Pre/Dis A. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. To view the | | ![](./media/image321. | | master details of a | | png){width="3.5in” | | record, select it | | height="0.12291666666 | | and click on the | | 666666in”} | | View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The record details | | ![](./media/image322. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.4652777 | | window. | | 777777777in” | | | | height="1.84375in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Click on the Page 2 | | ![](./media/image323. | | link to view other | | png){width="3.5in” | | record details, which | | height="1.85416666666 | | include the following | | 66667in”} | | payable interests: | | | | | | | | - Total Payable | | | | Interest | | | | | | | | - Base Payable | | | | Interest | | | | | | | | - Penalty Payable | | | | Interest | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. To view the | | ![](./media/image324. | | events of a record, | | png){width="3.5in” | | select it and click | | height="0.12361111111 | | on the Event A | | 111112in”} | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The events of the | | ![](./media/image325. | | master record are | | png){width="3.5in” | | listed on another | | height="1.85416666666 | | window. | | 66667in”} | | | | | | Select the relevant | | | | event and click on | | | | the View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The record details | | ![](./media/image326. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.5in” | | window. | | height="1.86041666666 | | | | 66666in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. To view the | | ![](./media/image324. | | Posting events of a | | png){width="3.5in” | | record, select it | | height="0.12361111111 | | and click on the | | 111112in”} | | Posting A button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Posting events of | | ![](./media/image327. | | the record are listed | | png){width="3.5in” | | on another window. | | height="1.86041666666 | | | | 66666in”} | | Select the relevant | | | | event and click on | | | | the View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Posting details | | ![](./media/image328. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.5in” | | window. | | height="1.86041666666 | | | | 66666in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 7. To view the | | ![](./media/image324. | | Accrual events of a | | png){width="3.5in” | | record, select it | | height="0.12361111111 | | and click on the | | 111112in”} | | Accrual A button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Accrual events of | | ![](./media/image329. | | the record are listed | | png){width="3.5in” | | on another window. | | height="1.85416666666 | | | | 66667in”} | | Select the relevant | | | | event and click on | | | | the View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Accrual details | | ![](./media/image330. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.5in” | | window. | | height="1.85486111111 | | | | 1111in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 8. To view the | | ![](./media/image324. | | Payment Schedule | | png){width="3.5in” | | events of a record, | | height="0.12361111111 | | select it and click | | 111112in”} | | on the Schedule A | | | | button. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | For information on | | | | this inquiry option, | | | | refer to [Appendix E: | | | | eLOAN Accrual Payment | | | | Schedule and Accrual | | | | Premium/Discount](#Ap | | | | pendix_E) | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Schedule events | | ![](./media/image331. | | of the record are | | png){width="3.5in” | | listed on another | | height="1.85555555555 | | window. | | 55556in”} | | | | | | Select the relevant | | | | event and click on | | | | the View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Schedule details | | ![](./media/image332. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.5in” | | window. | | height="1.85347222222 | | | | 22222in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 9. To view the | | ![](./media/image324. | | Premium/Discount | | png){width="3.5in” | | events of a record, | | height="0.12361111111 | | select it and click | | 111112in”} | | on the Pre/Dis A | | | | button. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | For information on | | | | this inquiry option, | | | | refer to [Appendix E: | | | | eLOAN Accrual Payment | | | | Schedule and Accrual | | | | Premium/Discount](#Ap | | | | pendix_E) | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Premium/Discount | | ![](./media/image333. | | events of the record | | png){width="3.5in” | | are listed on another | | height="1.85902777777 | | window. | | 77777in”} | | | | | | Select the relevant | | | | event and click on | | | | the View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Premium/Discount | | ![](./media/image334. | | details are shown on | | png){width="3.5in” | | another window. | | height="1.85902777777 | | | | 77777in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

{#section-21 .CS-head1}

Enquire Amortization Transaction

This function is used for enquiring an existing amortization transaction. No modification or change may be applied to the record through this function

The View, Event, and Posting buttons are provided in this function. These are used to display the record details.

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image335. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Inquire | | | | Functions > Enquire | | | | Amortization | | | | Transaction | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The Enquire | | ![](./media/image336. | | Amortization | | png){width="3.5in” | | Transaction | | height="1.72361111111 | | function catalog | | 11112in”} | | screen is | | | | displayed. | | | | | | | | To create the filter | | | | criteria for | | | | displaying records, | | | | specify the value for | | | | the Reference No. | | | | field. | | | | | | | | Click on the Next | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Select the | | ![](./media/image337. | | relevant record | | png){width="3.5in” | | from the list that | | height="1.72361111111 | | is displayed. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Three buttons are | | | | provided: View, Event | | | | M, and Posting M. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. To view the | | ![](./media/image338. | | master details of a | | png){width="2.9270833 | | record, select it | | 333333335in” | | and click on the | | height="0.23958333333 | | View button. | | 333334in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The record details | | ![](./media/image339. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.5in” | | window. | | height="1.85833333333 | | | | 33334in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. To view the | | ![](./media/image338. | | events of a record, | | png){width="2.9270833 | | select it and click | | 333333335in” | | on the Event M | | height="0.23958333333 | | button. | | 333334in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The events of the | | ![](./media/image340. | | master record are | | png){width="3.5in” | | listed on another | | height="1.86111111111 | | window. | | 11112in”} | | | | | | Select the relevant | | | | event and click on | | | | the View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The record details | | ![](./media/image341. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.5in” | | window. | | height="1.85694444444 | | | | 44445in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. To view the | | ![tmp2923](./media/im | | Posting events of a | | age342.jpeg){width="2 | | record, select it | | .9270833333333335in” | | and click on the | | height="0.27083333333 | | Posting button. | | 33333in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Posting events of | | ![](./media/image343. | | the record are listed | | png){width="3.5in” | | on another window. | | height="1.86180555555 | | | | 55555in”} | | Select the relevant | | | | event and click on | | | | the View button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | The Posting details | | ![](./media/image344. | | are shown on another | | png){width="3.5in” | | window. | | height="1.86041666666 | | | | 66666in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

Enquire eLOAN Voucher

This function is used for enquiring generated vouchers on loan transactions.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: The amount format applied for eLOAN vouchers are synchronized with EE.

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Run the | | ![](./media/image345. | | following function: | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Transaction > | | 11112in”} | | eLOAN Inquire | | | | Functions > Enquire | | | | eLOAN Voucher | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. The Enquire | | ![](./media/image346. | | eLOAN Voucher | | png){width="3.5in” | | function catalog | | height="1.72361111111 | | screen is | | 11112in”} | | displayed. | | | | | | | | To create the filter | | | | criteria for | | | | displaying records, | | | | specify the value of | | | | any of the Main Ref. | | | | No. field. | | | | | | | | Click on the Next | | | | button. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Select the | | ![](./media/image347. | | relevant record | | png){width="3.5in” | | from the list that | | height="1.72361111111 | | is displayed. Click | | 11112in”} | | on the Next button. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | Multiple records may | | | | be selected. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. The Enquire | | ![](./media/image348. | | eLOAN Voucher | | png){width="3.5in” | | function screen is | | height="1.75972222222 | | displayed on | | 22222in”} | | another window. | | | | | | | | Click on the Cancel | | | | button to go back to | | | | the catalog. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

{#section-22 .CS-ChapterTitle}

eLOAN Standing Data

  • eLOAN Account Type Maintenance Functions

  • eLOAN Rate Table Maintenance Functions

  • eLOAN System Parameter Maintenance Functions

eLOAN Account Type Maintenance Functions

Various eLOAN account types can be used to generate the eLOAN accounting entries upon posting.

The eLOAN Account Type Maintenance function group consists of the following functions:

  • Add eLOAN Account Type

  • Edit eLOAN Account Type

  • Delete eLOAN Account Type

  • Release eLOAN Account Type

  • Inquire eLOAN Account Type

  • Unlock eLOAN Account Type

{#section-23 .CS-head2}

Add eLOAN Account Type

The Add eLOAN Account Type function is used for adding an eLOAN account type and defining its details.

Information from these account types are used in certain eLOAN transaction functions such as Accrual Takedown.

Configuration

The Add eLOAN Account Type function provides three tabs: Account, Setting, eLOAN Voucher, and Additional Account.

[Account Type and Description Fields]{.underline}

These fields are displayed in all the tabs of the Add eLOAN Account Type function screen.

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account Type | | Specify the account | | | | type. This field | | | | accepts a maximum of | | | | 3 characters. | | | | | | | | This is a mandatory | | | | field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Description | | Provide a description | | | | of the account type. | | | | | | | | This is a mandatory | | | | field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

[Account Tab]{.underline}

The following fields are provided in this tab.

Figure A. 1 Add eLOAN Account Type - Account Tab

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Interest Receivable | | Specify the debit | | A/C No | | account number of the | | | | accrual in the | | Description | | Interest Receivable | | | | A/C No field. The | | | | browse button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Interest Income A/C | | Specify the account | | No | | number for the | | | | calculated interest | | Description | | in the Interest | | | | Income A/C No field. | | | | The browse button | | | | that accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Deferred Payment | | Specify the debit | | A/C No | | account number of the | | | | amortization in the | | Description | | Deferred Payment A/C | | | | No field. The browse | | | | button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Auto-Debit Customer | | This account number | | A/C No | | is for Accrual | | | | transactions only. If | | Description | | the Auto Debit flag | | | | of the Accrual | | | | transaction is | | | | enabled, the account | | | | number specified in | | | | this field replaces | | | | the Interest | | | | Receivable A/C | | | | Number. | | | | | | | | Specify this account | | | | number in the | | | | Auto-Debit Customer | | | | A/C No field. The | | | | browse button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Penalty Interest | | Specify the account | | Income A/C No | | number for the | | | | Delayed Interest | | Description | | Income in the Penalty | | | | Interest Income A/C | | | | No field. The browse | | | | button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Premium A/C No | | Specify the account | | | | number for the | | Description | | premium interest in | | | | the Premium A/C No | | | | field. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Discount A/C No | | Specify the account | | | | number for the | | Description | | Discount interest in | | | | the Discount A/C No | | | | field. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Exchange Rate | | Select the type of | | | | exchange rate, | | | | between the foreign | | | | currency and local | | | | currency, for the | | | | interest income. | | | | | | | | This is an optional | | | | field. | | | | | | | | [NOTE: | | | | ]{.underline} | | | | | | | | i. The options | | | | available in the | | | | dropdown list are | | | | defined in the Rate | | | | Description | | | | Maintenance | | | | function group of | | | | the Standing Data | | | | module. | | | | | | | | ii. If the value of | | | | the | | | | IA_GET_EXCH_RATE_ | | | | FLAG | | | | system parameter is | | | | set to 1, the | | | | system retrieves | | | | the exchange rate | | | | to be used for | | | | posting based on | | | | the value set in | | | | this field | | | | (Exchange rate | | | | value retrieved | | | | from the relevant | | | | records defined in | | | | the Exchange Rate | | | | Maintenance | | | | functions in the | | | | Standing Data | | | | module). Thus, this | | | | field cannot be | | | | blank in order to | | | | calculate the | | | | proper posting | | | | amount. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Local Currency | | Select the local | | | | currency code from | | | | the dropdown list. | | | | | | | | This is an optional | | | | field. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | If the value of this | | | | field is not defined, | | | | the local currency to | | | | be used for | | | | determining the | | | | exchange rate is | | | | retrieved from the | | | | EXIMSYS.STD_COUNTRY | | | | table based on the | | | | relevant country code | | | | of the transaction | | | | (i.e. This | | | | information is from | | | | the basic information | | | | of the relevant | | | | transaction; each | | | | transaction is done | | | | for a certain bank | | | | group + country). | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Local Interest | | In the Local Interest | | Income F/X A/C No | | Income F/X A/C No | | | | field, specify the | | Description | | local account number | | | | used when the | | | | interest receivables | | | | is in foreign | | | | currency. The browse | | | | button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | | | | | | | | [NOTE: | | | | ]{.underline} | | | | | | | | If the loan involves | | | | a foreign currency, | | | | make sure to specify | | | | the proper value for | | | | this field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Foreign Interest | | In the Foreign | | Income F/X A/C No | | Interest Income F/X | | | | A/C No field, specify | | Description | | the foreign account | | | | number used when the | | | | interest receivables | | | | is in foreign | | | | currency. The browse | | | | button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | | | | | | | | [NOTE: | | | | ]{.underline} | | | | | | | | If the loan involves | | | | a foreign currency, | | | | make sure to specify | | | | the proper value for | | | | this field. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Local | | In the Local | | Premium/Discount F/X | | Premium/Discount F/X | | A/C No. | | A/C No field, specify | | | | the local account | | Description | | number used when the | | | | premium or discount | | | | is in foreign | | | | currency. The browse | | | | button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Foreign | | In the Foreign | | Premium/Discount F/X | | Premium/Discount F/X | | A/C No. | | A/C No field, specify | | | | the foreign account | | Description | | number used when the | | | | premium or discount | | | | is in foreign | | | | currency. The browse | | | | button that | | | | accompanies this | | | | field may be used to | | | | retrieve the account | | | | number from the | | | | Account table. | | | | | | | | Provide a description | | | | of this account | | | | number in the | | | | corresponding | | | | Description field. | | | | | | | | These are optional | | | | fields. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

When the browse button is clicked, the Account No Express Builder window is displayed. Specify the details of the account number on this window and then click on the Confirm button to add the details into the relevant account number field in the Account Type Maintenance window.

Figure A. 2 Account No Express Builder Window

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Account No. | | Click on the Add | | | | button on this field. | | | | Select the relevant | | | | account number from | | | | the displayed list of | | | | account numbers from | | | | the Account Number | | | | table. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | Once selected, the | | | | account number is | | | | added into the text | | | | area provided. | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Other Information | | Select the details | | | | that may be added to | | | | the selected account | | | | number. The following | | | | values are made | | | | available in the | | | | dropdown list: | | | | | | | | - @, which is used | | | | > to add a | | | | > Borrower ID | | | | | | | | - &, which is used | | | | > to add a | | | | > Currency Code | | | | | | | | - %, which is used | | | | > to add a Branch | | | | > ID | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

[Setting Tab]{.underline}

The following fields are provided in this tab.

Figure A. 3 eLOAN Account Type - Setting Tab

Field Field Description

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Accrual Base | | Specify the accrual | | | | base. This field is | | | | optional. | | | | | | | | The setting may be | | | | one of the following: | | | | | | | | - Daily | | | | | | | | The interest is | | | | calculated as | | | | follows. | | | | | | | | P * R* Number of | | | | Days | | | | | | | | I = | | | | | | | | Base Days | | | | | | | | - Monthly | | | | | | | | The interest is | | | | calculated as | | | | follows. | | | | | | | | P * R Number of Days | | | | | | | | I = * | | | | | | | | > 12 Days of This | | | | > Month | | | | > | | | | > Where: | | | | | | | | - I: Interest | | | | | | | | - P: Outstanding | | | | > Payment Amount | | | | | | | | - R: Interest Rate | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | - ACT/ACT-ISDA | | | | | | | | The interest is | | | | calculated as | | | | follows. | | | | | | | | Interest = Principal | | | | * Coupon Rate * | | | | Factor | | | | | | | | Factor = Days not in | | | | leap year + Days in | | | | leap year | | | | | | | | 365 366 | | | | | | | | Where: | | | | | | | | > Days(StartDate, | | | | > EndDate) = This is | | | | > the number of | | | | > days between the | | | | > start date and end | | | | > date on a Julian | | | | > basis (i.e., all | | | | > days are counted). | | | | > Example: Days(15 | | | | > October 2007, 15 | | | | > November 2007). The | | | | > number of days is | | | | > 31. | | | | | | | | - ACT/ACT-ISMA | | | | | | | | > The interest is | | | | > calculated as | | | | > follows. | | | | | | | | Interest = Principal | | | | * Coupon Rate * | | | | Factor | | | | | | | | Factor = Days (Date1, | | | | Date2) | | | | | | | | > Freq * Days | | | | > (Date1, Date 3) | | | | > | | | | > Where: | | | | > | | | | > Date1 (Y1.M1.D1): | | | | > The start date | | | | > for the accrual. | | | | > This is usually the | | | | > coupon payment date | | | | > preceding Date2. | | | | > This is the “from” | | | | > date. | | | | > | | | | > Date2 (Y2.M2.D2): | | | | > This is the date | | | | > through which | | | | > interest is being | | | | > accrued. This is | | | | > the "to" date. | | | | > For a bond trade, | | | | > this is the | | | | > settlement date of | | | | > the trade. | | | | > | | | | > Date3 (Y3.M3.D3): | | | | > This is the | | | | > coupon payment | | | | > date, which follow | | | | > Date2. | | | | > | | | | > Days(StartDate, | | | | > EndDate): This is | | | | > the number of | | | | > days between the | | | | > start date and end | | | | > date on a Julian | | | | > basis (i.e., all | | | | > days are counted). | | | | > Example: Days(15 | | | | > October 2007, 15 | | | | > November 2007) | | | | > returns 31. | | | | > | | | | > Freq: This is | | | | > the coupon | | | | > payment frequency. | | | | > (e.g., 1 = annual, | | | | > 2 = semi-annual, 4 | | | | > = quarterly, 12 = | | | | > monthly) | | | | | | | | - ACT/ACT-AFB | | | | | | | | > The interest is | | | | > calculated as | | | | > follows. | | | | | | | | Interest = Principal | | | | * Coupon Rate * | | | | Factor | | | | | | | | Factor = Days (Date1, | | | | Date2) | | | | | | | | > DiY | | | | > | | | | > Where: | | | | > | | | | > Date1 (Y1.M1.D1): | | | | > The start date | | | | > for the accrual. | | | | > This is usually the | | | | > coupon payment date | | | | > preceding Date2. | | | | > This is the “from” | | | | > date. | | | | > | | | | > Date2 (Y2.M2.D2): | | | | > This is the date | | | | > through which | | | | > interest is being | | | | > accrued. This is | | | | > the "to" date. | | | | > For a bond trade, | | | | > this is the | | | | > settlement date of | | | | > the trade. | | | | > | | | | > Days(StartDate, | | | | > EndDate): This is | | | | > the number of | | | | > days between the | | | | > start date and end | | | | > date on a Julian | | | | > basis (i.e., all | | | | > days are counted). | | | | > Example: Days(15 | | | | > October 2007, 15 | | | | > November 2007) | | | | > returns 31. | | | | > | | | | > DiY: This is | | | | > equal to 365 (if | | | | > the calculation | | | | > period does not | | | | > contain 29^th^ | | | | > February) or 366 | | | | > (if 29 February | | | | > falls within the | | | | > Calculation Period | | | | > or Compounding | | | | > Period). | | | | > | | | | > If the Calculation | | | | > Period or | | | | > Compounding Period | | | | > is a term of more | | | | > than one year, the | | | | > basis must be | | | | > calculated as | | | | > follows: | | | | | | | | - the number of | | | | > complete years | | | | > must be counted | | | | > back from the | | | | > last day of the | | | | > Calculation | | | | > Period or | | | | > Compounding | | | | > Period; and | | | | | | | | - this number must | | | | > be increased by | | | | > the fraction | | | | > for the | | | | > relevant period | | | | > calculated. | | | | | | | | > When counting | | | | > backwards for this | | | | > purpose, if the | | | | > last day of the | | | | > relevant period is | | | | > 28th February, the | | | | > full year must be | | | | > counted back to the | | | | > previous 28th | | | | > February unless | | | | > 29th February | | | | > exists, in which | | | | > case, 29th February | | | | > must be used. | | | | | | | | - 30/ACT-ISDA | | | | | | | | The interest is | | | | calculated as | | | | follows. | | | | | | | | > Interest = | | | | > Principal * Coupon | | | | > Rate * Factor | | | | | | | | Factor = Days not in | | | | leap year + Days in | | | | leap year | | | | | | | | 365 366 | | | | | | | | > Where: | | | | > | | | | > Days(StartDate, | | | | > EndDate): This | | | | > specifies a month | | | | > as 30 days, and | | | | > returns the number | | | | > of days between the | | | | > start date and end | | | | > date. | | | | > | | | | > Example: | | | | | | | | Start Date（G11） D | | | | 1（I11） =IF(DAY(G11) | | | | =31,30,DAY(G11)) | | | | ——————- | | | | ———– ——– | | | | ——————— | | | | ——————— | | | | ——————— | | | | – | | | | End Date （H11） D | | | | 2（J11） =IF(AND(DAY( | | | | H11)=31,(OR(DAY(G11)= | | | | 31,DAY(G11)=30))),30, | | | | MIN(DAY(H11),31)) | | | | Days Count | | | | =(YEAR(H | | | | 11)-YEAR(G11))*360+( | | | | MONTH(H11)-MONTH(G11) | | | | )*30+(J11-I11) | | | | | | | | - 30/ACT-ISMA | | | | | | | | > The interest is | | | | > calculated as | | | | > follows. | | | | | | | | Interest = Principal | | | | * Coupon Rate * | | | | Factor | | | | | | | | Factor = Days (Date1, | | | | Date2) | | | | | | | | > Freq * Days | | | | > (Date1, Date 3) | | | | > | | | | > Where: | | | | > | | | | > Date1 (Y1.M1.D1): | | | | > The start date | | | | > for the accrual. | | | | > This is usually the | | | | > coupon payment date | | | | > preceding Date2. | | | | > This is the “from” | | | | > date. | | | | > | | | | > Date2 (Y2.M2.D2): | | | | > This is the date | | | | > through which | | | | > interest is being | | | | > accrued.
