1, for Multi Thread | | | | - 0, for Single Thread (Default) | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_THREAD_NO | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the maximum thread number in a batch process, if the | | system parameter IA_BATCH_RUNNING_MODE is set to 1 (Multi Thread). | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Number of threads (Integer) | | | | - Default value: 3 | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_TRXNO_BY_THREAD | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the maximum number of transactions handled under one | | thread in a batch process. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Number of transactions (Integer). | | | | - Default value: 100 | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_BATCH_WAIT_MODE | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether or not the system is to wait for the end of | | the task. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 1, for Yes (Default) | | | | - 0, for No | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_CALCULATION_METHOD | +———————————————————————–+ | Round Type When Pay Interest | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - D, for Round Down (Default) | | | | - R, for Round | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_ SYSTDATE_BUDATE | +———————————————————————–+ | This is used to specify the basis for the last date of the interest | | accrual and posting record to be generated. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - BUDATE, in which interest accrual and posting records are | | > generated up to the day prior the current business unit start | | > of day date. | | | | - The parameter is not added, or its value is not BUDATE, in which | | > the interest accrual and posting records are generated up to | | > the day prior the current server date. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_DIR_POST_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Direct Post I or F while Transaction (Reserve for future use) | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Yes (Default) | | | | - N, for No | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_ENDOFMONTH_ONHOLIDAY_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates if the eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual and eLOAN Batch | | Posting processes are to be run by the eLOAN system until the end of | | the month or until the day before the next working day, based on the | | weekend/holiday setting. | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | The usage of this system parameter is the same as setting the | | following parameters with these corresponding values: | | | | IA_BATCH_ON_WEEKHOLIDAY = Y and; | | | | IA_MONTH_END = Y/N | | | | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | The system parameter is set to Y, and November 30 is the last day of | | the month. When either the eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual or eLOAN | | Batch Posting is run on November 28, the interest is accrued, or the | | eLOAN system computations are posted, for November 28, 29, and 30. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLOAN Batch Posting processes until the end of a month, if that | | > day is included in certain weekend and holiday setting. | | | | - N, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLOAN Batch Posting processes until the day before the next | | > working day, according to the weekend and holiday setting. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_EXTEND_RATE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This controls whether or not the extension rate covers the Base Rate | | and Spread Rate after the extension rate. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Exchange Rate only | | | | - N, for Base Rate + Spread Rate + Extension Rate (Default) | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_ACCRUAL | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Accrual Accrue Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_EVENT | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Accrual Event Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_POSTING | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Accrual Posting Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_PREDIS | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the Function to be used for inquiring eLOAN Accrual | | Premium/Discount Details. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQACC_SCHEDULE | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the Function to be used for inquiring eLOAN Accrual | | Schedule Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQAMZ_EVENT | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Amortization Event Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_FUNCID_INQAMZ_POSTING | +———————————————————————–+ | Function for Inquire Amortization Posting Details | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - To be selected from the dropdown list | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_GET_EXCH_RATE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Get Exchange Rate | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 0, in which the exchange rate to be used for eLOAN processing is | | retrieved by the system from the value of the IA_N_EXCH_RATE | | field. | | | | - 1, in which the exchange rate to be used for eLOAN processing is | | retrieved by the system from the Exchange Rate table (Standing | | Data module > Exchange Rate Maintenance functions) to get the | | real-time rate. | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | The IA_N_EXCH_RATE field may be added to the relevant function and | | configured through the GAPI settings. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_GL_INTF_BANK_NAME | +———————————————————————–+ | This is used to define the bank name. The system then calls the | | corresponding eLOAN logic for this specific bank. | | | | If this parameter is not set or if it is defined with a blank value, | | the system applies the eLOAN standard logic. Otherwise, the | | corresponding logic for the defined bank is applied. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - [Bank Name] | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_MERGE_REF_WITH_ACTYPE | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field | | is to be combined with the Account Type setting as the final | | IA_C_REF_NO value, or not. | | | | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | If the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field transferred from EE | | is IPLC000001, and the account type used in the transaction is D01, | | the final value of IA_C_REF_NO that is recorded in the eLOAN table | | is IPLC000001D01. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field is | | > combined with the account type setting to generate the final | | > IA_C_REF_NO value. | | | | | | | | - N, in which the mapping value of the IA_C_REF_NO field is also | | the final IA_C_REF_NO value. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_MONTH_END_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This system parameter is only used if the value of the system | | parameter IA_BATCH_ON_WEEKHOLIDAY is set to Y. | | | | This indicates if the eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual and eLOAN Batch | | Posting processes are to be run by the eLOAN system until the end of | | the month or until the day before the next working day, based on the | | weekend/holiday setting. | | | | [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | The system parameter is set to Y, and Saturday is the last day of the | | month. When either the eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual or eLOAN Batch | | Posting is run on Friday, the interest is accrued, or the eLOAN | | system computations are posted, on Saturday. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLOAN Batch Posting processes until the end of a month, if that | | > day is included in certain weekend and holiday setting. | | | | - N, in which the eLOAN system runs the Batch Interest Accrual and | | > eLOAN Batch Posting processes until the day before the next | | > working day, according to the weekend and holiday setting. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_POST_EXCH_ENTRY_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Post Exchange Entries when transaction currency is different from | | local currency | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, for Yes (Default) | | | | - N, for No | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_POSTING _ZERO_INTEREST | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates whether zero interest entries are to be posted or not. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, in which zero interest entries are posted. | | | | - N, in which zero interest entries are not posted. | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | If this system parameter is not defined, zero interest entries are | | posted by the system. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_RATEDESC_MAP1, IA_RATEDESC_MAP2, IA_RATEDESC_MAP3, | | IA_RATEDESC_MAP4, IA_RATEDESC_MAP5, IA_RATEDESC_MAP6, | | IA_RATEDESC_MAP7, IA_RATEDESC_MAP8 | +———————————————————————–+ | Rate Table Description 1, Rate Table Description 2, Rate Table | | Description 3, Rate Table Description 4, Rate Table Description 5, | | Rate Table Description 6, Rate Table Description 7, Rate Table | | Description 8. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - User-defined | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_RATTBL_BACKVALUE_MODE | +———————————————————————–+ | Run Rate Table Back Valuation Mode | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - A, for Auto (Default) | | | | - M, for Manual | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | The M option is reserved for future use. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_REVERSE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | Reverse Flag for rollback entries | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - N, for No (Default) | | | | - Y | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_SCHEDULE_PERIOD | +———————————————————————–+ | This indicates the relevant period for generating schedule | | information. The basic unit is per year. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 0, in which all the schedule and premium/discount data are | | > generated automatically once the eLOAN Accrual Takedown | | > transaction is confirmed. | | | | - 1, in which the schedule and premium/discount data for one year | | > are generated automatically once all the eLOAN Accrual Takedown | | > transaction is confirmed. | | | | - 2, in which the schedule and premium/discount data for two years | | > are generated automatically once all the eLOAN Accrual Takedown | | > transaction is confirmed. | | | | > [NOTE:]{.underline} | | > | | > If the value of this parameter is set to either 1 or 2, the | | > schedule and premium/discount data for either one or two years | | > (based on the parameter value) are generated. The Schedule From and | | > Schedule To dates are set based on this value. However, when the | | > Batch Interest Accrual function is run, if the Accrual Date is less | | > than one year away from the Schedule To Date, the schedule and | | > premium/discount data are continuously generated up to one or two | | > years (based on the parameter value) after the Accrual date. | | > | | > [EXAMPLE:]{.underline} | | | | 1. The IA_SCHEDULE_PERIOD parameter is set to 2. | | | | 2. Run an Accrual Takedown transaction. In the Enquire Accrual | | Transaction function, it is displayed that the schedule and | | premium/discount data for two years are generated. Based on two | | years (parameter value), the first Schedule To date is set to | | 2011/12/20, and the last Schedule From date is set to 2014/03/16. | | | | 3. Run the Batch Interest Accrual function and specify an Accrual | | Date that is less than one year away from the last Schedule To | | date. (e.g., Accrual Date: 2013/03/17). | | | | 4. In the Enquire Accrual Transaction function, it is displayed that | | the schedule and premium/discount data are generated continuously | | up to the date that is two years (parameter value) from the | | specified Accrual Date. | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_TODATE_INCLUDE_FLAG | +———————————————————————–+ | This controls whether or not the To Date field is to be used when | | inquiring interests. | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - Y, to include (Default) | | | | - N, to not include | +———————————————————————–+ | IA_TRX_COMMIT_BY | +———————————————————————–+ | Transaction Commit By | +———————————————————————–+ | Values: | | | | - 1, if the transaction is to be committed by eLOAN | | | | - 0, if the transaction is to be committed by EE (Default) | +———————————————————————–+

eLOAN GAPI

  • eLOAN transaction codes
  • eloan gapi template tags

{#section-30 .CS-head1}

eLOAN Transaction Codes

Transaction for Accrual

Take Down 8030 Re Take Down 8056 Payment(Pay Int., Pay Prin. Pay P+I) 8036 First Hand Interest 8014 Create Or Regenerate New Payment Schedule 8024 Get Total Unpaid Interest 8025 Refund Interest 8032 Extension/Shorten 8038 Rate Change 8040 Change Account Type 8080 Change Base Days 8082 Change Penalty Rate 8034 Stop 8046 Restart 8048 Rollback 8042 Cancel 8044 Inquire Interest 8013

Transaction for Amortization

Take Down 8061 Re Take Down (Increase) 8075 Payment(Decrease) 8063 Extension/Shorten 8067 Rollback 8090 Cancel 8065 Inquire Interest 8023 Stop 8066 Restart 8064 Batch Function
Batch Interest Accrue 8028 Batch Interest Posting 8029 Batch Pre Advice 8027 Batch Generate Schedule 8024

{#section-31 .CS-head1}

eLOAN GAPI Template Tags

Accrual Take Down (8030)

Field ID Field Description

IA_C_EVENT_NO Event Number

Accrual Rate Change (8040)

Send Tags

+———————————–+———————————–+ | Field ID | Field Description | +===================================+===================================+ | IA_C_REF_NO | Reference Number | +———————————–+———————————–+ | C_UNIT_CODE | Unit Code | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_MODU_NAME | Module Name | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_D_TRX_VALDATE | Transaction Value Date | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE | Fixed Rate | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE | Fixed Spread Rate | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_FLT_RAT_TBLID | Floating Rate Table ID | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_I_FLT_RATE_NO | Floating Rate Number | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_SPR_RAT_TBLID | Spread Rate Table ID | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_I_SPR_RATE_NO | Spread Rate Number | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_N_BUSINESS_TAX | Business Tax | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_N_STAMP_TAX | Stamp Tax | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_CREATE_FROM | Create from system | | | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | | | This field indicates if the | | | current transaction is created | | | from the Eximbills Interface (1) | | | or the eLOAN Transaction Module | | | (3). | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_FUNCTION_ID | Which Function ID | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_D_CREATE_DATE | System Date-time | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_CREATE_BY | User Name | +———————————–+———————————–+

interface | | | which corresponds to the eLOAN | | | event that invokes the inquire | | | GAPI. For example, if the inquire | | | GAPI is used for an eLOAN | | | Amortization Takedown | | | transaction, the value of this | | | field must be 8061. If the | | | inquire GAPI is used for an eLOAN | | | Amortization Payment transaction, | | | the value of this field must be | | | 8063. | +———————————–+———————————–+

Batch Generate Schedule (8024)

Send Tags

Field ID Field Description

IA_D_SCHE_TODATE Schedule To Date

{#section-32 .CS-ChapterTitle}

eLOAN Tables

{#section-33 .CS-head1}

eLOAN Tables

The following are the eLOAN tables.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. The table type of all eLOAN tables is set to COMMON.

ii. The eLOAN Database can be same as Transaction database of the EE Core System, or a distributed database.

Iii. The value of the C_CP_UNIT_CODE field that is recorded in the eLOAN tables is the value defined for this field in the corresponding GAPI mapping setting. Otherwise, if no setting is defined in the GAPI mapping for this field, the value of the C_PARENT_UNIT field in the EXIMUSER.SEC_BUSINESS_UNIT table is used.

Table Table Description

IAAC_ACCMASTERLAY eLOAN Accrual Master Table IAAC_ACCEVENTLAY eLOAN Accrual Event Table IAAC_ACCPOSTINGLAY eLOAN Accrual Posting Table IAAC_ACCRUALLAY eLOAN Accrual Accrual Table IAAC_ACCPDLAY Accrual Information for Payment Schedule + Premium/Discount Table IAAC_ACCSCHEDTLLAY eLOAN Accrual Schedule Table (Header Info) IAAC_ACCSCHELAY eLOAN Accrual Schedule Table (Detail information for each segment included in a certain schedule) IAAC_PREADVICELAY eLOAN Pre-Advice Table IAAC_AMZMASTERLAY eLOAN Amortization Master Table IAAC_AMZEVENTLAY eLOAN Amortization Event Table IAAC_AMZPOSTINGLAY eLOAN Amortization Posting Table STD_ACCOUNT_TYPE eLOAN Account Type Table STT_ACCOUNT_TYPE eLOAN Account Type Temp Table STD_RATE_TABLE eLOAN Rate Table (Header Info) STD_RATE_VALUE eLOAN Rate Table (Detail Info) IASEQID eLOAN Sequence Definition Table

IAAC_ACCMASTERLAY

Transaction Code IA_D_ACCESS_DATE DATE Access Date IA_D_CREATE_DATE DATE Create Date IA_D_DUE_DATE DATE Due Date IA_D_LAST_ACCDATE DATE Last Accrue Date IA_D_LAST_INT_PAID DATE Latest Interest Paid Date IA_D_LAST_INT_REFUND DATE Last Refund Interest Date IA_D_LAST_POSTDATE DATE Last Posted Date IA_D_NEXT_POSTDATE DATE Next Posting Date IA_D_OS_DATETIME DATE OS Date and Time IA_D_TRX_VALDATE DATE Transaction Value Date IA_I_BASE_DAYS NUMBER(22,0) Base Days IA_I_CCY_DEC NUMBER(22,0) Currency Code Decimal IA_I_FLT_RATE_NO NUMBER(22,0) Floating Rate Number IA_I_LOCALCCY_DEC NUMBER(22,0) Local Currency Code Decimal IA_I_SPR_RATE_NO NUMBER(22,0) Spread Rate Number IA_N_BUSINESS_TAX NUMBER(15,10) Business Tax IA_N_CURRNT_ACCADJ NUMBER(15,8) Current Account Adjust IA_N_CURRNT_ADJINT NUMBER(15,8) Current Adjust Interest IA_N_EXCH_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Exchange Rate IA_N_EXTEND_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Extend Rate IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Fixed Rate IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Fixed Spread Rate IA_N_INT_MONTODATE NUMBER(24,4) Interest Month to Date IA_N_PEN_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Penalty Spread Rate IA_N_STAMP_TAX NUMBER(15,10) Stamp Tax IA_Y_OUTSD_AMT NUMBER(24,4) Outstanding Amount IA_Y_PAID_INT NUMBER(24,4) This Paid Interest IA_Y_REFUND_INT NUMBER(24,4) Refund Interest Amount IA_Y_TRX_AMT NUMBER(24,4) Transaction Amount IA_Y_TTL_CUST_INT NUMBER(24,4) Total Customer Interest IA_Y_TTL_PAID_INT NUMBER(24,4) Total Paid Interest IA_Y_TTL_POST_INT NUMBER(24,4) Total Posted Interest IA_Y_TTL_REFUND_INT NUMBER(24,4) Total Refund Interest

IAAC_AMZEVENTLAY

PRIMARY KEYS: IA_C_REF_NO, IA_C_MODU_NAME, IA_C_EVENT_NO, C_UNIT_CODE
Field Length Description C_BK_GROUP_ID VARCHAR2(12) Bank Group ID C_CNTY_CODE VARCHAR2(2) Country Code C_CP_UNIT_CODE VARCHAR2(12) Process Center Unit Code C_UNIT_CODE VARCHAR2(12) Business Unit Code IA_C_CREATE_FROM VARCHAR2(35) Create From IA_C_CUST_CODE VARCHAR2(50) Customer Code IA_C_DIS_CUSTCCY VARCHAR2(3) Customer Paid Currency Code IA_C_DIS_LOCALCCY VARCHAR2(3) Discount Local Currency IA_C_EVENT_NO VARCHAR2(6) Event Number IA_C_EVENT_TYPE VARCHAR2(35) eLOAN Event Type IA_C_FLT_RAT_TBLID VARCHAR2(35) Floating Rate Table ID IA_C_FORM_ID VARCHAR2(30) Form ID IA_C_FUNCTION_ID VARCHAR2(35) Function ID IA_C_MODU_NAME VARCHAR2(4) Module Name IA_C_POST_ARD_FLG VARCHAR2(1) Posting Already Flag IA_C_PURP_ID VARCHAR2(15) Purpose ID IA_C_REC_TYPE VARCHAR2(1) eLOAN Record Type (A/M) IA_C_REF_NO VARCHAR2(35) Reference Number IA_C_ROLBAK_EVTNO VARCHAR2(6) Rollback Event Number IA_C_ROLLBACK_FLG VARCHAR2(1) Rollback Flag IA_C_SPR_RAT_TBLID VARCHAR2(35) Spread Rate Table ID IA_C_TRANS_CODE VARCHAR2(50) eLOAN Transaction Code IA_D_ACCESS_DATE DATE Access Date IA_D_CREATE_DATE DATE Create Date IA_D_DUE_DATE DATE Due Date IA_D_OS_DATETIME DATE OS Date and Time IA_D_TRX_VALDATE DATE Transaction Value Date IA_I_BASE_DAYS NUMBER(22,0) Base Days IA_I_CCY_DEC NUMBER(22,0) Currency Code Decimal IA_I_CUSTCCY_DEC NUMBER(22,0) Customer Paid Currency Decimal IA_I_FLT_RATE_NO NUMBER(22,0) Floating Rate Number IA_I_LOCALCCY_DEC NUMBER(22,0) Local Currency Code Decimal IA_I_SPR_RATE_NO NUMBER(22,0) Spread Rate Number IA_N_BUSINESS_TAX NUMBER(15,10) Business Tax IA_N_EXCH_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Exchange Rate IA_N_EXTEND_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Extend Rate IA_N_FIX_BAS_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Fixed Rate IA_N_FIX_SPR_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Fixed Spread Rate IA_N_PEN_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Penalty Spread Rate IA_N_STAMP_TAX NUMBER(15,10) Stamp Tax IA_Y_CURR_CUSTINT NUMBER(24,4) Current Customer Paid Interest IA_Y_CURR_DEFINT NUMBER(18,3) Current Deferred Interest IA_Y_CURR_OUTAMT NUMBER(24,4) Current Outstanding Amount IA_Y_CUST_INT NUMBER(18,3) Customer Paid Interest Amount IA_Y_EQVL_INT NUMBER(18,3) Customer Paid Equivalence IA_Y_PAID_INT NUMBER(24,4) This Paid Interest IA_Y_PREV_CUSTINT NUMBER(24,4) Previous Customer Interest IA_Y_PREV_DEFINT NUMBER(24,4) Previous Deferred Interest IA_Y_PREV_OUTAMT NUMBER(24,4) Previous Outstanding Amount IA_Y_REFUND_INT NUMBER(24,4) Refund Interest Amount IA_Y_TRX_AMT NUMBER(24,4) Transaction Amount I_EVENT_TIMES NUMBER(22,0) Event Times

IAAC_AMZPOSTINGLAY

PRIMARY KEYS: IA_C_REF_NO, IA_C_MODU_NAME, IA_C_EVENT_NO, C_UNIT_CODE
Field Type and Length Description C_BK_GROUP_ID VARCHAR2(12) Bank Group ID C_CNTY_CODE VARCHAR2(2) Country Code C_CP_UNIT_CODE VARCHAR2(12) Process Center Unit Code C_UNIT_CODE VARCHAR2(12) Business Unit Code IA_C_ACCESS_BY VARCHAR2(35) Access By IA_C_ACCOUNT_TYPE VARCHAR2(3) Account Type IA_C_BORROWER_ID VARCHAR2(35) Borrower ID IA_C_CCY_CODE VARCHAR2(3) Currency Code IA_C_CREATE_BY VARCHAR2(35) Create By IA_C_CREATE_TYPE VARCHAR2(1) Create Type IA_C_EVENT_NO VARCHAR2(6) Event Number IA_C_MODU_NAME VARCHAR2(4) Module Name IA_C_ORIG_CODE VARCHAR2(1) Origin Code IA_C_POST_ARD_FLG VARCHAR2(1) Posting Already Flag IA_C_POST_CCY VARCHAR2(3) Posted Currency IA_C_POST_CODE VARCHAR2(1) Posted Code IA_C_POST_TYPE VARCHAR2(1) Posting Type IA_C_REC_TYPE VARCHAR2(1) eLOAN Record Type (A/M) IA_C_REF_NO VARCHAR2(35) Reference Number IA_C_ROLLBACK_FLG VARCHAR2(1) Rollback Flag IA_D_ACCESS_DATE DATE Access Date IA_D_CREATE_DATE DATE Create Date IA_D_OS_DATETIME DATE OS Date and Time IA_D_POST_DATE DATE Posted Date IA_D_POST_FROMDATE DATE Post From Date IA_D_POST_TODATE DATE Post To Date IA_I_NO_OF_DAYS NUMBER(22,0) Number of Days IA_N_ADJUST_INT NUMBER(15,8) Previous Adjust Interest IA_N_CURRNT_ADJINT NUMBER(15,8) Current Adjust Interest IA_N_EXCH_RATE NUMBER(15,10) Exchange Rate IA_Y_POST_AMT NUMBER(18,3) Posted Amount IA_Y_VCH_AMT NUMBER(18,3) Voucher Amount I_EVENT_TIMES NUMBER(22,0) Event Times

EXIMSYS.STT_ACCOUNT_TYPE and EXIMSYS.STD_ACCOUNT_TYPE

[NOTE:]{.underline} The following fields apply to the eLOAN system
Field Type and Length Description C_PREM_ACT VARCHAR2(50) Premium Account No C_PREM_ACT_DES VARCHAR2(50) Premium Account Description C_DISC_ACT VARCHAR2(50) Discount Account No C_DISC_ACT_DES VARCHAR2(50) Discount Account Description C_FORGNPD_ACT VARCHAR2(50) Foreign Premium/Discount Account No C_FORGNPD_ACT_DES VARCHAR2(50) Foreign Premium/Discount Description C_LOCALPD_ACT VARCHAR2(50) Local Premium/Discount Account No C_LOCALPD_ACT_DES VARCHAR2(50) Local Premium/Discount Description

STD_RATE_TABLE

PRIMARY KEYS: C_BK_GROUP_ID, C_CNTY_CODE, C_RATE_ID
Field Type and Length Description C_BK_GROUP_ID VARCHAR2(12) Bank Group ID C_CNTY_CODE VARCHAR2(2) Country Code C_UNIT_CODE VARCHAR2(12) Business Unit Code C_RATE_ID VARCHAR2(32) Rate ID C_RATE_NAME VARCHAR2(32) Rate Name I_RATE_TYPE VARCHAR2(32) Rate Type I_TIER_DAY1, I_TIER_DAY2, I_TIER_DAY3, I_TIER_DAY4, I_TIER_DAY5, I_TIER_DAY6, I_TIER_DAY7, I_TIER_DAY8, DECIMAL(40) Tier Days T_LAST_MODI VARCHAR2(14) Previous Customer Interest C_ADD_FLAG VARCHAR2(14) Add Flag C_LOCKED_FLAG VARCHAR2(1) Locked Flag C_TRX_STATUS VARCHAR2(1) Transaction Status C_REFUSE_REASON VARCHAR2(128) Refuse Reason C_LOCKED_OP VARCHAR2(32) Locked Operator C_FUNC_ID VARCHAR2(12) Function ID I_EVENT_TIMES NUMBER(22,0) Event Times T_LAST_MODIFY_TIME TIMESTAMP(6,11) Last Modify Time

STD_RATE_VALUE

PRIMARY KEYS: C_BK_GROUP_ID, D_VAL_DATE, C_RATE_ID
Field Type and Length Description C_BK_GROUP_ID VARCHAR2(12) Bank Group ID C_CNTY_CODE VARCHAR2(2) Country Code C_UNIT_CODE VARCHAR2(12) Business Unit Code C_RATE_ID VARCHAR2(32) Rate ID D_VAL_DATE DATE(16) Value Date N_RAT_VAL1, N_RAT_VAL2, N_RAT_VAL3, N_RAT_VAL4, N_RAT_VAL5, N_RAT_VAL6, N_RAT_VAL7, N_RAT_VAL8, DECIMAL(17) Rate Value B_RAT_REV VARCHAR2(1) System Reserved

IASEQID (EXIMSYS)

PRIMARY KEYS: C_BK_GROUP_ID, C_CNTY_CODE, C_TABLE_NAME
Field Type and Length Description C_BK_GROUP_ID VARCHAR2(9) Bank Group ID C_CNTY_CODE VARCHAR2(3) Country Code C_ID VARCHAR2(10) ID C_TABLE_NAME VARCHAR2(20) Table Name

eLOAN Accrual Payment Schedule and Accrual Premium/Discount

{#section-34 .CS-head1}

{#section-35 .CS-head1}

eLOAN Accrual Payment Schedule and Accrual Premium/Discount

In the Enquire Accrual Transaction function, the details of the accrual payment schedule and accrual premium/discount may be retrieved by clicking on the corresponding Schedule A and Pre/Dis A buttons. To enable these functionalities, the relevant eLOAN system tables, functions, and system parameters must first be configured.

eLOAN System Tables

Import the following eLOAN system tables through the DB Dictionary function in the Maintenance group of the EE Utility.

  • IAAC_PDLAY

  • IAAC_SCHEDTLLAY

  • IAAC_ACCSCHELAY

The table type to be assigned for these system tables is COMMON.

Figure E. 1 DB Dictionary: eLOAN System Tables

Coupon Type Field

In the DB Dictionary function of the EE Utility, add the following transaction field:

  • Field Name: IA_C_CPN_TYPE

  • EE Type: Varchar 10

Figure E. 2 DB Dictionary: Coupon Type Field

This field corresponds to the Coupon type field in the eLOAN Accrual Takedown function that is used in the related GAPI setting (8030).

IAAC_MASTER Fields

Add the following fields in the IAAC_MASTER table:

  • IA_D_LAST_SCHEDATE

  • IA_D_LAST_PDDATE

  • IA_Y_CURRNT_BV_AMT

  • IA_Y_TTL_PDINT

Run the Reformat process after adding the fields to the table.

Figure E. 3 DB Dictionary: IAAC_MASTER Fields

GAPI Template and GAPI Mapping Settings

Add the following tags in the GAPI Template and GAPI Mapping settings of the following functions. These tags are used primarily to retrieve the schedule and premium/discount information from the relevant eLOAN transactions.

+———————————–+———————————–+ | GAPI Tag Name | Description | +===================================+===================================+ | IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT | This indicates the current | | | transaction amount. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_D_LAST_CPNDATE | This indicates the last coupon | | | payment date. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_SCHE_TYPE | This indicates the payment | | | schedule type. This may contain | | | any of the following values: | | | | | | - 1-Schedule Interest Only | | | | | | - Null – Without Payment | | | Schedule | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_CPN_TYPE | Coupon Type | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_AMZ_FLG | This indicates the flag for | | | amortization of premium/discount. | | | This may contain any of the | | | following values: | | | | | | - AFS – Available For Sale | | | | | | - HTM – Held To Maturity | | | | | | - Trading –Trading Service | | | | | | - FVPL - Fair Value through | | | Profit or Loss | | | | | | - LOANREC | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_DLY_FLG | This indicates the delay flag. | | | | | | For the transactions with coupon | | | frequency on March, June, | | | September and December, the | | | interest accrual ends on | | | Wednesday of the third week every | | | month. For others, the interest | | | accrual ends on Wednesday of the | | | third week every month based on | | | the Holiday and Weekend setting. | | | | | | This field is reserved for | | | future use. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_Y_PAID_INT | This indicates the paid interest | | | amount. | +———————————–+———————————–+

  • Accrual Take Down (8030)

Add the following send tags:

  • IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT

  • IA_D_LAST_CPNDATE

  • IA_C_SCHE_TYPE

  • IA_C_CPN_TYPE

  • IA_C_AMZ_FLG

  • IA_C_DLY_FLG

[GAPI Template]{.underline}

[GAPI Mapping]{.underline}

  • Accrual Re-TakeDown (8056)

Add the following send tag:

  • IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT

[GAPI Template]{.underline}

[GAPI Mapping]{.underline}

  • Accrual Amend (8052)

Add the following send tags:

  • IA_Y_BV_TRX_AMT

  • IA_Y_PAID_INT

[GAPI Template]{.underline}

[GAPI Mapping]{.underline}

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to Appendix C: eLOAN GAPI for the complete list of tags that are included in the GAPI template of the relevant eLOAN functions.

Enquire Accrual Payment Schedule

Create the Enquire Accrual Schedule function – which is used to inquire on the payment schedule information for eLOAN Accrual transactions – using the following details.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: This function is not required to be added into a function group. It must only be specified in the IA_FUNC_INQACC_SCHEDULE eLOAN system parameter for inquiring the payment schedule. Refer to the eLOAN System Parameters step in this procedure for more information.

+———————————————————————–+ | Screen | +=======================================================================+ | - [EximBillWeb.war folder]/screen/eLOAN/IAAC_InqAccSchedule.jsp | | | | {width="6.290575240594926in” | | height="1.3958333333333333in”} | +———————————————————————–+ | Attribute | +———————————————————————–+ | - Component Name: Trx Master Edit Rec | | | | - Event Name: MASTER | | | | - Schema: TRX | | | | - Transaction Table Name: IAAC_ACCSCHEDTLLAY | | | | - Main Reference Number: C_MAIN_REF | | | | - Post/Inquire: Inquire | | | | {width="6.302083333333333in” | | height="1.8541666666666667in”} | +———————————————————————–+ | Catalog | +———————————————————————–+ | - JSP Name: catalog.jsp | | | | - Table: IAAC_ACCSCHELAY | | | | - Fields: IA_C_MODU_NAME, IA_C_REF_NO, IA_C_TENOR, | | IA_D_SCHE_FROMDATE, IA_D_SCHE_TODATE, IA_Y_SCHE_AMOUNT, | | IA_Y_SCHE_INT | | | | - Condition: | | | | > IA_C_TENOR OPERAND ‘VALUE’ ORDER BY IA_C_TENOR_NO | | | | {width="6.290277777777778in” | | height="3.337341426071741in”} | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | This catalog setting – wherein the IA_C_TENOR_NO field is | | required - is used to display the Schedule List when the user clicks | | on the Schedule A button in the Enquire Accrual transction function | | to view the schedule information. Other catalog field settings may be | | added based on the specific requirements. | +———————————————————————–+ | Function | +———————————————————————–+ | - Main Program: Trx Manager Inq | | | | {width="5.59375in” | | height="4.083333333333333in”} | +———————————————————————–+

Enquire Accrual Premium/Discount

Create the Enquire Accrual Premium/Discount function – which is used to inquire on the premium/discount information for eLOAN Accrual transactions – using the following details.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: This function is not required to be added into a function group. It must only be specified in the IA_FUNCID_INQACC_PREDIS eLOAN system parameter for inquiring on the premium/discount information. Refer to the eLOAN System Parameters step in this procedure for more information.

+———————————————————————–+ | Screen | +=======================================================================+ | - [EximBillWeb.war folder]/screen/eLOAN/IAAC_InqAccPreDis.jsp | | | | {width="6.19764435695538in” | | height="1.6145833333333333in”} | +———————————————————————–+ | Attribute | +———————————————————————–+ | - Component Name: Trx Master Edit Rec | | | | - Event Name: MASTER | | | | - Schema: TRX | | | | - Transaction Table Name: IAAC_ACCSPDLAY | | | | - Main Reference Number: C_MAIN_REF | | | | - Post/Inquire: Inquire | | | | {width="6.197222222222222in” | | height="3.287970253718285in”} | +———————————————————————–+ | Catalog | +———————————————————————–+ | - JSP Name: catalog.jsp | | | | - Table: IAAC_ACCPDLAY | | | | - Fields: IA_C_MODU_NAME, IA_C_REF_NO, C_UNIT_CODE, | | IA_C_TENOR, IA_D_SCHE_FROMDATE, IA_D_SCHE_TODATE, | | IA_Y_PD_INT, IA_Y_P_BVOUTAMT, IA_Y_TTL_PDINT, | | IA_C_CCY_CODE, IA_N_CURRNT_ADJINT | | | | - Condition: | | | | > IA_C_TENOR OPERAND ‘VALUE’ ORDER BY IA_C_TENOR_NO | | | | {width="6.165217629046369in” | | height="3.270990813648294in”} | | | | [NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | This catalog setting – wherein the IA_C_TENOR_NO field is | | required - is used to display the Premium/Discount Interest List when | | the user clicks on the Pre/Dis A button in the Enquire Accrual | | transction function to view the premium/discount information. Other | | catalog field settings may be added based on the specific | | requirements. | +———————————————————————–+ | Function | +———————————————————————–+ | - Main Program: Trx Manager Inq | | | | {width="5.572916666666667in” | | height="4.104166666666667in”} | +———————————————————————–+

XML Generation

Generate the XML files for the Table Structure, GAPI, Screen, Attribute, Catalog, and Function parameters.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE:

i. For Domain groups setting, generate the Calculation parameter to generate the related JS files.

ii. To ensure that the eLOAN system JSP files are updated, generate the Screen parameter for all related functions including the functions of the eLOAN Standalone module and the eLOAN functions included in the Standing Data module.

iii. To ensure that the eLOAN system tables are updated, generate the Table Structure parameter for all related tables.

[]{#Paymentschedule_eLOAN_system_para .anchor}eLOAN System Parameters

Through the eLOAN System Parameter Maintenance functions in the Standing Data module, add the following eLOAN system parameters and assign the newly created functions – Enquire Accrual Schedule and Enquire Premium/Discount - as the value for these system parameters.

+———————————–+———————————–+ | - Parameter Name: | {width=” | | | 4.041666666666667in” | | > IA_FUNCID_INQACC_SCHEDULE | height="1.9901760717410324in”} | | | | | - Parameter Value: | | | | | | > [Enquire Accrual Schedule | | | > function name] | | +===================================+===================================+ | - Parameter Name: | {width=” | | | 4.041666666666667in” | | > IA_FUNCID_INQACC_PREDIS | height="1.9901760717410324in”} | | | | | - Parameter Value: | | | | | | > [Enquire Accrual | | | > Premium/Discount function | | | > name] | | +———————————–+———————————–+

Transaction Processing

  1. Create the account type to be used in the Accrual transaction.

  • Account Type: DA1

  • Accrual Base: Daily

  • Premium A/C No: PR0001

  • Discount A/C No: DI0001

  • Local Premium/Discount F/X A/C No: LIN0001

  • Foreign Premium/Discount F/X A/C No: FIN0001

  1. Run the Accrual TakeDown function and process a transaction.

  • Account Type: DA1

  • Transaction Amount: 10,000.00

  • Book Transaction Amount: 10,500.00

  • Payment Schedule Type: Schedule Interest Only

  • Amortize Flag: Yes

  • Coupon Type: Quarterly

  • Last Coupon Payment Date: 2020-03-20

  1. Run the Enquire Accrual function. Select the relevant transaction and click on the Schedule A button.

{width="5.447916666666667in” height="2.6826334208223974in”}

  1. The payment schedule details of the transaction are shown on a separate screen.

  1. Select the relevant transaction and click on the Pre/Dis A button.

{width="4.860416666666667in” height="2.393340988626422in”}

  1. The premium/discount details of the transaction are shown on a separate screen.

Other eLOAN Functionalities

  • eLOAN BATCH SETTINGS

eLOAN Batch Settings

Based on requirements, interest accrual and posting may be generated by batch per module, for all modules, or prior the current business unit start of day date. These are configured through the Batch Manager function of the EE Utiltiy.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the EE Utility Reference: Transaction Functions documentation for more details on the Batch Manager function.

eLOAN Batch Tasks by Module

eLOAN Batch Interest Accrual and eLOAN Batch Posting tasks may be run automatically by creating user batch jobs. These jobs may include interest accrual and posting tasks:

  • per module; or,

  • by all modules

To generate eLOAN interest accrual and posting per module, the value of the IA_C_MODU_NAME field in the catalog condition of the task − which is attached to the user batch job − must be defined. Otherwise, if the value of this field is not defined, the interest accrual and posting for all modules are generated.

Once this user batch task is run, the corresponding eLOAN interest accrual, posting, and vouchers are automatically generated.

{width="0.3333333333333333in” height="0.3333333333333333in”}NOTE: Refer to the Utility Reference: Transaction Functions manual for more information on the Batch Manager function.

Do the following . . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. In the | | ![](./media/image487. | | AutoProcessTaskMgr | | png){width="3.5in” | | system batch, add | | height="1.85694444444 | | the subtask for | | 44445in”} | | interest accrual | | | | with the following | | | | details: | | | | | | | | - Sub Task Name: | | | | IABatchIntAccTask | | | | | | | | - Sub Task | | | | Description: | | | | IABatchIntAccTask | | | | | | | | - Initial Status: | | | | End | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | IABatchIntAccTask | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. Add the subtask | | ![](./media/image488. | | for posting with | | png){width="3.5in” | | the following | | height="1.85694444444 | | details: | | 44445in”} | | | | | | - Sub Task Name: | | | | IABatchPostingTas | | | | k | | | | | | | | - Sub Task | | | | Description: | | | | IABatchPostingTas | | | | k | | | | | | | | - Initial Status: | | | | End | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | IABatchPostingTas | | | | k | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. Specify the Task | | ![](./media/image489. | | property of the | | png){width="3.5in” | | interest accrual | | height="1.85694444444 | | batch task. | | 44445in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | In the catalog | | ![](./media/image490. | | condition, assign the | | png){width="3.5in” | | relevant module to | | height="1.85694444444 | | the IA_C_MODU_NAME | | 44445in”} | | field to generate the | | | | interest accrual | | | | details for this | | | | particular module. | | | | | | | | Click on the OK | | | | button. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | If the value of the | | | | IA_C_MODU_NAME | | | | field is not defined, | | | | the interest accrual | | | | for all modules are | | | | generated. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. Specify the Task | | ![](./media/image491. | | property of the | | png){width="3.5in” | | posting batch task. | | height="1.85694444444 | | | | 44445in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | In the catalog | | ![](./media/image492. | | condition, assign the | | png){width="3.5in” | | relevant module to | | height="1.85694444444 | | the IA_C_MODU_NAME | | 44445in”} | | field to generate the | | | | posting details for | | | | this particular | | | | module. | | | | | | | | In this version, only | | | | one module may be set | | | | in the catalog | | | | condition. | | | | | | | | Click on the OK | | | | button. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | If the value of the | | | | IA_C_MODU_NAME | | | | field is not defined, | | | | the posting details | | | | for all modules are | | | | generated. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. Create a user | | ![](./media/image493. | | batch task and | | png){width="3.5in” | | attach the created | | height="1.95416666666 | | interest accrual | | 66666in”} | | and posting tasks. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | Attach the created | | ![](./media/image494. | | interest accrual and | | png){width="3.5in” | | posting tasks to this | | height="1.95416666666 | | user batch task. | | 66666in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. Define the | | ![](./media/image495. | | sequence on which | | png){width="3.5in” | | the created tasks | | height="1.95416666666 | | are run. | | 66666in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 7. Generate the xml | | ![](./media/image496. | | files for the Batch | | png){width="3.5in” | | Manager parameter. | | height="1.84722222222 | | | | 22223in”} | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | ![](./media/image497. | | | | png){width="3.5in” | | Restart the | | height="1.8375in”} | | application server to | | | | apply the changes | | | | made. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 8. Log on the EE | | ![](./media/image498. | | browser and process | | png){width="3.5in” | | an accrual takedown | | height="1.72361111111 | | transaction to | | 11112in”} | | create a record in | | | | the relevant | | | | module. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 9. In the User | | ![](./media/image499. | | Batch Manager | | png){width="3.5in” | | function of the | | height="1.70069444444 | | Daily Maintenance | | 44445in”} | | group in the System | | | | Maintenance module, | | | | start the created | | | | batch task. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 10. In the | | ![](./media/image500. | | generated sql log | | png){width="3.4440004 | | file, the batch | | 374453195in” | | process is | | height="2.22678040244 | | recorded. The | | 96938in”} | | relevant module is | | | | included in the | | | | Where condition. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 11. Run the Enquire | | ![](./media/image501. | | Accrual Transaction | | png){width="3.5in” | | function. It is | | height="1.72361111111 | | displayed that the | | 11112in”} | | accrual and posting | | | | files for the | | | | relevant record in | | | | the corresponding | | | | module is | | | | generated. | | | | | | | | Click on the Accrual | | | | A button | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 12. The accrual | | ![](./media/image502. | | event details are | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.85067804024 | | | | 49694in”} | | Click on the Cancel | | | | button to close the | | | | event details screen. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 13. Click on the | | ![](./media/image501. | | Posting A button | | png){width="3.5in” | | | | height="1.72361111111 | | | | 11112in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 14. The posting | | ![](./media/image503. | | event details are | | png){width="3.5in” | | displayed. | | height="1.84162839020 | | | | 1225in”} | | Click on the Cancel | | | | button to close the | | | | event details screen. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 15. Run the Enquire | | ![](./media/image504. | | eLOAN Voucher | | png){width="3.5in” | | function in the | | height="1.72361111111 | | eLOAN Inquire | | 11112in”} | | Functions group. | | | | The accrual and | | | | posting files are | | | | generated. | | | | | | | | For the relevant | | | | record in the | | | | corresponding module, | | | | the voucher files are | | | | generated. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

eLOAN Batch Before the Next Working Day

The eLOAN Interest Accrual and Posting for a specific transaction may be generated through user batch jobs, which scope may either be per module, or for all modules. The sub-task to be created must include the IABatchBeforeNextWorkingDay class.

In addition, the eLOAN system parameter IA_SYSTDATE_BUDATE may be used to specify the basis for the last date of the interest accrual and posting record to be generated. If this set to BUDATE, interest accrual and posting records are generated up to the day prior the current business unit start of day date. Otherwise, if this parameter is not added, or if its value is not set to BUDATE, the interest accrual and posting records are generated up to the day prior the current server date.

To Configure the eLOAN Batch Before Next Working Day By Module. . .

+———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 1. Create a subtask | | ![](./media/image505. | | in the | | png){width="3.5in” | | AutoProcessTaskMgr | | height="1.85694444444 | | System Batch with | | 44445in”} | | the following | | | | details: | | | | | | | | - Subtask Name: | | | | IABatchBeforeNext | | | | WorkingDay | | | | | | | | - Initial Status: | | | | Start | | | | | | | | - Class Name: | | | | IABatchBeforeNext | | | | WorkingDay | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 2. Add the eLOAN | | ![](./media/image506. | | batch task | | png){width="3.5in” | | eLOANBatchIntAccTaskB | | height="1.85694444444 | | eforeNextWorkingDayBy | | 44445in”} | | Module. | | | | | | | | Select | | | | IABatchBeforeNextWork | | | | ingDay | | | | as the task | | | | component. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. In the Catalog | | ![](./media/image507. | | tab, define the | | png){width="3.5in” | | catalog condition. | | height="1.85694444444 | | Assign the relevant | | 44445in”} | | module to the field | | | | IA_C_MODU_NAME, | | | | if the relevant | | | | eLOAN task is to be | | | | run per module. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | Refer to the [eLOAN | | | | Batch Tasks by | | | | Module](#eloan-batch- | | | | tasks-by-module) | | | | discussion for more | | | | information on | | | | generating Interest | | | | Accrual and Posting | | | | records per module or | | | | by all modules. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. Create the user | | ![](./media/image508. | | batch job | | png){width="3.5in” | | eLOANBatchTaskSystemD | | height="1.85694444444 | | ate-1ByModule. | | 44445in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. Attach the | | ![](./media/image509. | | eLOANBatchIntAccTaskB | | png){width="3.5in” | | eforeNextWorkingDayBy | | height="1.85694444444 | | Module | | 44445in”} | | task to the created | | | | user batch job. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 6. Generate the XML | | ![](./media/image510. | | files for the user | | png){width="3.4055555 | | batch job and task. | | 555555554in” | | | | height="2.85643591426 | | | | 0717in”} | | | | | | | | ![](./media/image511. | | | | png){width="3.4306933 | | | | 50831146in” | | | | height="1.75521325459 | | | | 31758in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 7. In the EE | | ![](./media/image512. | | browser, add the | | png){width="3.5in” | | system parameter | | height="1.72361111111 | | IA_SYSTDATE_BUDATE | | 11112in”} | | through the eLOAN | | | | System Parameter | | | | Maintenance | | | | functions in the | | | | Standing Data | | | | module. | | | | | | | | In this sample | | | | procedure, this | | | | system parameter is | | | | set to BUDATE. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | The application | | | | server may require to | | | | be restarted for the | | | | changes to be | | | | applied. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 8. In the User | | ![](./media/image513. | | Batch Manager | | png){width="3.5in” | | function of the | | height="1.74236111111 | | Daily Maintenance | | 1111in”} | | group in the System | | | | Maintenance module, | | | | start the | | | | eLOANBatchTaskSystemD | | | | ate-1ByModule | | | | user batch job. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 9. The SQL log | | ![](./media/image514. | | displays the | | png){width="3.4479166 | | generated interest | | 666666665in” | | accrual and posting | | height="1.33333333333 | | details. The | | 33333in”} | | relevant module is | | | | included in the SQL | | | | Where condition. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 10. Run the Enquire | | | | Accrual Transaction | | | | function. This | | | | function displays | | | | the generated | | | | accrual and posting | | | | files for the | | | | corresponding | | | | record in the | | | | relevant module, | | | | after running the | | | | user batch job. | | | | | | | | Since the | | | | IA_SYSTDATE_BUDATE | | | | system parameter is | | | | set to BUDATE, the | | | | accrual and posting | | | | files are generated | | | | up to the day before | | | | the current business | | | | unit start of day | | | | date. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 11. In the Enquire | | | | eLOAN Voucher | | | | function, the | | | | vouchers for the | | | | corresponding | | | | record in the | | | | relevant module are | | | | displayed. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+

To Configure the eLOAN Batch Before Next Working Day For All Modules . . .

Add the eLOAN | | ![](./media/image519. | | batch task | | png){width="3.5in” | | eLOANBatchIntAccTaskB | | height="1.85694444444 | | eforeNextWorkingDayBy | | 44445in”} | | All. | | | | | | | | Select | | | | IABatchBeforeNextWork | | | | ingDay | | | | as the task | | | | component. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 3. In the Catalog | | ![](./media/image520. | | tab, no value must | | png){width="3.5in” | | be assigned to the | | height="1.85694444444 | | IA_C_MODU_NAME | | 44445in”} | | field when defining | | | | the catalog | | | | condition, if the | | | | relevant eLOAN task | | | | is to be run for | | | | all modules. | | | | | | | | **[NOTE:]{.underline} | | | | ** | | | | | | | | Refer to the [eLOAN | | | | Batch Tasks by | | | | Module](#eloan-batch- | | | | tasks-by-module) | | | | discussion for more | | | | information on | | | | generating Interest | | | | Accrual and Posting | | | | records per module or | | | | by all modules. | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 4. Create the user | | ![](./media/image521. | | batch job | | png){width="3.5in” | | eLOANBatchTaskSystemD | | height="1.85694444444 | | ate-1ByAll. | | 44445in”} | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | | | | +———————–+———————–+———————–+ | 5. Glossary

Glossary

a

+———————————–+———————————–+ | Account Type | Includes the following | | | information: | | | | | | - Various account numbers to be | | | posted for different eLOAN | | | processes | | | | | | - Penalty days allowed and | | | applicable penalty spread | | | rate, if payment is made | | | after the maturity date | | | | | | - Whether the accrual base to | | | be used for interest | | | calculations is daily or | | | monthly | | | | | | - Frequency of interest | | | calculations and postings |

+===================================+===================================+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual | Involves the periodic calculation | | | of interest for an amount over a | | | period of time. Accrued interest | | | is not charged at the time of | | | creation of the loan. Hence, the | | | money lent to the borrower is the | | | full amount of the principal, | | | with interest charged to the loan | | | on a periodic basis. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Amend | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to modify the details of | | | an Accrual transaction | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Cancel | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to cancel an accrual loan | | | transaction | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Change Account Type | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to modify the account | | | type in an accrual transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Change Base Days | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to change the base days | | | to be applied when calculating | | | the interest of transactions. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Change Penalty Rate | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to change the penalty | | | rate to be applied for late | | | interest payment. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Extend & Shorten | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used if the due date of the | | | loan must be extended or | | | shortened. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Inquire Interest | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to view the interest | | | accrued over a specified period. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Payment | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to define the | | | configuration for processing the | | | payment of a loan transaction’s | | | Principal, Pay Interest, or Pay | | | Principal and Interest. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Rate Change | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to modify the interest | | | rate to be applied to the loan | | | transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Refund Interest | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used if the customer has | | | already paid the interest, and | | | this interest must be refunded. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Restart | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to restore a stopped | | | transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual ReTakedown | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to specify the relevant | | | configurations if the original | | | loan amount must be increased. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Rollback | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to rollback all the eLOAN | | | events performed up to a defined | | | rollback date. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Stop | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to stop the accrual of | | | interest and the posting of a | | | transaction, temporarily. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Accrual Takedown | An eLOAN Accrual function which | | | is used to create an accrual | | | transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Add eLOAN Account Type | A function in the eLOAN Account | | | Type Maintenance group in the | | | Standing Data module which is | | | used for adding an eLOAN account | | | type and defining its details. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Add eLOAN Rate Table | A function in the eLOAN Rate | | | Table Maintenance group in the | | | Standing Data module which is | | | used for adding a floating rate | | | table or an individual floating | | | rate. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Add eLOAN System Parameter | A function in the eLOAN System | | | Parameter Maintenance group in | | | the Standing Data module which is | | | used for maintaining an eLOAN | | | system parameter that has | | | originally been developed in the | | | EE Utility. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization | Involves the discounting of a | | | loan amount at a particular rate | | | for a specified period of time. | | | Interest is charged at the time | | | of the creation of the loan. The | | | money released to the borrower is | | | the amount of the principal less | | | the interest charged. The | | | outstanding amount is collected | | | in full at the maturity of the | | | loan. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization Amend | An eLOAN Amortization function | | | which is used to modify the | | | details of an amortization | | | transaction | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization Cancel | An eLOAN Amortization function | | | which is used to cancel an | | | amortization loan transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization Extend and | An eLOAN Amortization | | Shorten | functionwhich is used to extend | | | or shorten the due date of the | | | loan. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization Payment | An eLOAN Amortization function | | | which is used to process the | | | payment of the loan amount. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization Retakedown | An eLOAN Amortization function | | | which is used to increase the | | | original amount of the loan. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization Rollback | An eLOAN Amortization function | | | which is used to rollback all the | | | eLOAN events performed up to a | | | defined date. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Amortization Takedown | An eLOAN Amortization function | | | which is used to create an | | | amortization transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+

B

Back Valuation Processing of a transaction with an effective value date that is earlier than its submission to the system. It involves recalculation of the interest based on this effective value date. See Rate Table Back Valuation also.

Base Days The number of days to be used when calculating the interest of transactions.

Base Floating Rate The initial rate that changes or fluctuates throughout the term of the loan

Base Payable Interest Pertains to the payable interest excluding the interest spread.

Batch Tasks The tasks that are automatically run according to a defined schedule and/or criteria.

Bond A debt security in which the issuer owes the holder a debt, and is obliged to pay the interest (coupon), and/or repay the principal at the bond’s maturity.

Bond Discount The difference between the amount received (excluding accrued interest) and the bond’s face amount.

Bond Premium The amount received for the bond (excluding accrued interest) that is in excess of the bond’s face amount

Book Value A company's total assets excluding its intangible assets and liabilities, such as debt. A company's book value might be higher or lower than its market value.

Business Unit A processing center or a branch unit of a bank-country group.

C

Cancel Event pertaining to the cancellation of a loan. Previously posted accounting entries are reversed if the transaction is cancelled back to the date of takedown of the loan. If the cancellation date is later than the last posting of interest, no reversal of entries is performed. The cancelled transaction is no longer processed during the accrual of interest.

***Change Account Type *** Accrual event pertaining to a change in account of a particular loan. Subsequent computations of interest and posting uses the new account type information. This event is applicable to Accrual processes only.

***Change Base Days *** Accrual event pertaining to a change in base days of a particular loan. Subsequent computations of interest uses the new base days information. Base Days is usually related to currency code. This event is applicable only to Accrual processes only.

Change Penalty Rate Accrual event pertaining to a change in the effective penalty rate of a particular loan when the loan becomes overdue. Subsequent computations of interest then use the new penalty rate. This event is applicable to Accrual processes only.

Coupon Pertains to the interest paid on a bond.

Coupon Payment Frequency The values specified in the Last Coupon Payment Date and Coupon Type fields in the Accrual Takedown function are used to specify the Coupon Payment Frequency, by using the ‘CMNN’ format. The coupon payment frequency that follows the CMNN format can be viewed when the specific accrual transaction is viewed by inquiring the eLOAN event information.

D

Delete eLOAN Account Type A function in the eLOAN Account Type Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for deleting an eLOAN account type.

Delete eLOAN Rate Table A function in the eLOAN Rate Table Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for deleting an eLOAN Rate Table record.

Delete eLOAN System Parameter A function in the eLOAN System Parameter Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for deleting an eLOAN system parameter.

E

+———————————–+———————————–+ | EE Utility | Short for Eximbills Enterprise | | | Utility Workbench. This is the | | | main tool for building parameters | | | in EE. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Edit eLOAN Account Type | A function in the eLOAN Account | | | Type Maintenance group in the | | | Standing Data module which is | | | used for correcting or modifying | | | eLOAN Account Type records. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Edit eLOAN Rate Table | A function in the eLOAN Rate | | | Table Maintenance group in the | | | Standing Data module which is | | | used for correcting or modifying | | | an eLOAN Rate Table record. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Edit eLOAN System Parameter | A function in the eLOAN System | | | Parameter Maintenance group in | | | the Standing Data module which is | | | used for correcting or modifying | | | eLOAN system parameter. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | EJB | Stands for Enterprise Java Beans; | | | it is a technology that is the | | | server-side component | | | architecture for Java Platform, | | | Enterprise Edition (Java EE). | | | This enables rapid and simplified | | | development of distributed, | | | transactional, secure and | | | portable applications based on | | | Java technology. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | eLOAN Batch Generate | An eLOAN batch function that is | | Schedule | used for generating the schedule | | | and premium/discount information | | | in the specified time period. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | eLOAN Batch Interest | An eLOAN batch function that is | | Accrual | used to trigger the eLOAN system | | | to accrue all the transactions of | | | a process center and its | | | branches. The system also checks | | | for holidays and non-business | | | dates before processing the | | | computations for interest | | | accrual. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | eLOAN Batch Posting | An eLOAN batch function that is | | | used to post the eLOAN system | | | computations for the different | | | transactions in the database. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | eLOAN Account Type | See Account Type*.* | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***eLOAN Events*** | See Takedown , Re-Takedown , | | | Payment , Refund Interest , | | | Extend / Shorten Due Date , Rate | | | Change , Change Penalty Rate , | | | Change Account Type , Change Base | | | Days , Rollback , Stop / Restart | | | , Cancel , and Online Accrual | | | Event*.* | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***eLOAN Interest Accrual*** | See Interest Accrual*.* | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***eLOAN Interest Rate Types*** | See Fixed Rate, Spread Rate, | | | Extension Rate, Penalty Spread | | | Rate, Floating Rate, and Tier | | | Floating Rate*.* | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***eLOAN Posting*** | See Posting*.* | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***eLOAN Pre Advice*** | An eLOAN batch function that is | | | used for generating a | | | ‘pre-advice’ on the amount of | | | interest accrued or amount to be | | | paid for a specified period. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***eLOAN System Parameters*** | System-wide settings for | | | activating or configuring the | | | specific features of the eLOAN | | | sub-system | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***eLOAN Transaction Codes*** | Codes that correspond to an eLOAN | | | transaction which are used as | | | interface names for eLOAN GAPI | | | templates. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Enquire Accrual Transaction*** | An eLOAN Inquire function that is | | | used for enquiring an existing | | | accrual transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Enquire Amortization | An eLOAN Inquire function that is | | Transaction*** | used for enquiring an existing | | | amortization transaction. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Enquire eLOAN Voucher*** | An eLOAN Inquire function that is | | | used for enquiring generated | | | vouchers on loan transactions. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Eximbills Enterprise (EE) *** | An integrated system that | | | automates and audits the complete | | | cycle of Trade Finance, Open | | | Account, and Payments | | | transactions, in real time and in | | | accordance with SWIFT, UCP, and | | | ISO20022 standards. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Eximbills Services Platform | A shared service system that is | | (ESP)*** | mainly used for SWIFT MT Message | | | Management and SWIFT C2B | | | (Corporate to Bank) service. It | | | facilitates the transmission of | | | SWIFT messages from bank to bank, | | | from corporate customers to banks | | | (C2B) or from banks to customers | | | (B2C). | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Extend / Shorten Due Date *** | Event pertaining to the extension | | | or shortening of the maturity | | | date for the loan: | | | | | | Extension: The value date of the | | | extension event must be on or | | | after the maturity date. | | | | | | Shorten: Interest is refunded to | | | the borrower. | | | | | | This event is applicable to both | | | Accrual and Amortization | | | processes. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Extension Rate*** | Additional spread rate applied to | | | a loan during an extension | | | period. | +———————————–+———————————–+

F

Field The smallest unit that can hold data.

First Hand Interest The first hand interest of the loan is calculated from the last interest date to the day before the Accrual Takedown value date, based on the specified account type.

Fixed Rate Constant interest affixed to the principal amount for the duration of the loan, without regard for the changing prime rate of the bank. A user can define one fixed rate for each currency. This rate may be used as the default value during transaction input.

Floating Rate Rate that changes or fluctuates throughout the term of the loan.

Function A unified set of elements, operations, and configurations that produce a target setting, process, and/or output. This typically refers to an EE Utility function or a transaction function.

G

GAPI Stands for Generic Application Programming Interface. A mechanism for integrating with other systems such as the bank’s core banking system, front-end system, and accounting system. GAPI enables EE to communicate with these systems for data exchange, data transfer, and data inquiry.

Grace Days Pertains to the number of days after the Due Date during which penalty interest is not posted.

I

+———————————–+———————————–+ | Inquire eLOAN Account Type | A function in the eLOAN Account | | | Type Maintenance group in the | | | Standing Data module which is | | | used for inquiring master eLOAN | | | Account Type records. | +===================================+===================================+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Inquire eLOAN Rate Table | A function in the eLOAN Rate | | | Table Maintenance group in the | | | Standing Data module which is | | | used for inquiring master eLOAN | | | Rate Table records. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Inquire eLOAN System | A function in the eLOAN System | | Parameter | Parameter Maintenance group in | | | the Standing Data module which is | | | used for inquiring an existing | | | eLOAN system parameter. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Interest | The price paid for borrowing | | | money, which is expressed as a | | | percentage rate over a period of | | | time and reflects the rate of | | | exchange of present consumption | | | for future consumption. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Interest Accrual | Function that calculates the | | | interest due for each loan and | | | posts the relevant accounting | | | entries. This function is run at | | | the end of each business day; the | | | system calculates the total | | | accrued interest on each account | | | due for accrual. Whether the | | | account is due for accrual is | | | determined by the following | | | criteria: | | | | | | - Loan due date | | | | | | - Posting Frequency specified | | | > in the account type used | | | | | | - Related events, for example: | | | > Pay Interest, Change | | | > Account Type, etc. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | IA_C_MODU_NAME | A field to which the relevant | | | module must be assigned in the | | | task's catalog condition to | | | generate accrual and posting | | | details per module. | +———————————–+———————————–+

M

Module A group of functions that perform interrelated processes and operate under a general principle or objective (e.g., a system module, which is essential to system processes; a business or transaction module, which pertains to a bank service or product).

O

Online Accrual Process of forward interest accrual. It enables the user to perform an on-line accrual and inquire on the projected interest for the specified period.

P

+———————————–+———————————–+ | Parameter | Any user-controlled configuration | | | that defines a factor or logic | | | within a set of interrelated | | | operations; performs a specific | | | action in a group of processes; | | | or produces a categorical result | | | or setting. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | ***Payment *** | Event that includes Pay | | | Principal, Pay Interest, and Pay | | | Principal & Interest. | | | | | | A Payment Principal event refers | | | to the payment of the principal | | | amount. This event refers to the | | | payment of both Accrual and | | | Amortization transactions. | | | However, partial payment | | | principal for an amortization | | | refunds interest to the borrower. | | | | | | An Interest Paid event refers to | | | the payment of the interest | | | amount due. This event applies | | | only to Accrual transactions. | | | | | | For an Amortization transaction, | | | an Interest Paid event is not | | | applicable since interest is | | | deducted in advance at the | | | creation of a loan. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Penalty Payable Interest | Pertains to the interest that is | | | generated generated after due | | | date and grace days. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Penalty Spread Rate | Rate that is added to the | | | interest rate if the loan is not | | | settled on the maturity date. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Posting | Process at the end of business | | | hours each day performed by the | | | system to generate the relevant | | | posting entries from all accounts | | | that are due to have debit or | | | credit interest entries posted | | | that day. The interest entries to | | | be posted follow the posting code | | | attached to each eLOAN accounting | | | entry depending on the event | | | performed. | +———————————–+———————————–+ | | | +———————————–+———————————–+ | Principal | Total amount of money being | | | borrowed or lent, excluding the | | | finance charges required to be | | | paid for the loan. | +———————————–+———————————–+

R

***Rate Change *** Accrual event pertaining to a change in the effective rate of a particular loan. Subsequent computations of interest use the new rate. This event is applicable to Accrual processes only.

Rate Table Back Valuation Reprocessing of transactions due to changes in the rate structure.

Release eLOAN Account Type A function in the eLOAN Account Type Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for processing the release of eLOAN Account Type records that require the Release process.

Release eLOAN Rate Table A function in the eLOAN Rate Table Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for processing the release of eLOAN Rate Table records that require the Release process.

Release eLOAN System Parameter A function in the eLOAN System Parameter Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for processing the release of eLOAN system parameters that require the Release process.

Restart/Stop Process that is used to restart or stop interest accrual processing for a selected transaction record from a specified date. This event is applicable to Accrual processes.

***ReTakedown\ Event pertaining to an increase in the transaction amount under a created loan. Re-Takedown ***

***Rollback *** Process of reversing all eLOAN events performed up to a certain date, called the rollback date. This allows the system to redo all the interest postings starting on the rollback date. After a Rollback event is done on a transaction, the reversed eLOAN events are kept in the eLOAN Event File with a marked Rollback flag. This event is applicable to Accrual and Amortization processes.

***Refund Interest *** Event that pertains to refunding interest to a borrower. As an event, it is only applied to Accrual processes.

S

Spread Rate Rate that is either added to or subtracted from a rate to cover customer risk levels. Thus, the Spread Rate field can have either a positive or a negative value. A spread rate may be defined according to customer type and transaction type.

Stop / Restart Process that is used to stop or restart interest accrual processing for a selected transaction record from a specified date. This event is applicable to Accrual processes.

T

***Takedown *** Event pertaining to the creation of a loan. This event applies to both Accrual and Amortization processes.

Tier Floating Rate A tier structure where different rates are applied based on different periods of the loan.

Total Payable Interest Pertains to Base Interest plus Spread Interest.

Trans Back Valuation See Back Valuation.

Transaction Codes See eLOAN Transaction Codes*.*

U

Unlock eLOAN Account Type A function in the eLOAN Account Type Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for unlocking an eLOAN Account Type record that has been held and locked for such reasons as system failure and processing errors, or if the record is being modified by another user.

Unlock eLOAN Rate Table A function in the eLOAN Rate Table Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for unlocking an eLOAN Rate Table record that has been held and locked for such reasons as system failure and processing errors, or if the particular record is being modified by another user.

Unlock eLOAN System Parameter A function in the eLOAN System Parameter Maintenance group in the Standing Data module which is used for unlocking an eLOAN system parameter that has been held and locked for such reasons as system failure and processing errors, or if the particular record is being modified by another user.

V

Value Date Also known as the transaction value date. It is the date on which the takedown (loan creation) transaction or eLOAN event transaction takes effect. With takedown transactions, this is the date on which the loan amount is released to the borrower and the interest calculation starts.

X

XML Stands for Extensible Markup Language. This is the format used by EE for the communication between the client (browser) and the server.

XML Generator The EE Utility function that is used to generate the corresponding XML files for a specific parameter setting.
